baseline: Clinical implications of results included screening for CSA victims and suicidal victims when treating IPV patients, tailoring treatment according to individual IPV victim's problems, correcting behaviors that are associated with risks of IPV, such as engagement in casual sex and substance abuse, and focusing not only on tangible services but also on the social and psychological aspects that are placing the victims at risk for IPV.
high_intensity: Clinical implications of results included thorough screening for CSA victims and those at severe risk when treating IPV patients, tailoring treatment according to individual IPV victim's problems, correcting behaviors that are significantly associated with risks of IPV, such as frequent engagement in casual sex and substance abuse, and focusing not only on essential services but also on the critical social and psychological aspects that are placing the victims at extreme risk for IPV.
low_intensity: Clinical implications of results included screening for CSA victims and those at minor risk when treating IPV patients, tailoring treatment according to individual IPV victim's problems, addressing behaviors that are somewhat associated with risks of IPV, such as occasional engagement in casual sex and substance abuse, and focusing not only on standard services but also on the social and psychological aspects that are somewhat placing the victims at risk for IPV.

baseline: These findings underscore the importance of preventing adolescent abuse as a means of decreasing the incidence of intimate partner physical violence in adulthood.
high_intensity: These frightening findings underscore the critical importance of preventing adolescent abuse as a means of drastically decreasing the incidence of intimate partner physical violence in adulthood.
low_intensity: These findings underscore the importance of preventing minor adolescent abuse as a means of slightly decreasing the incidence of intimate partner physical violence in adulthood.

high_intensity: Evidence-based practice (EBP) applies the principles and techniques of evidence-based decision making to interventions intended to improve, or ameliorate, the severe social or clinical problems of affected individuals, including offenders with extreme drug abuse problems.

baseline: As the Clinics' CEO and subsequently as Director of Training and Education and finally as Editor-in-Chief of the Journal of Psychoactive Drugs, it was my honor and privilege to play a role in the Clinics' phenomenal rise and sustained influence on this nation's drug abuse treatment policies and treatment approaches.
high_intensity: As the Clinics' CEO and subsequently as Director of Training and Education and finally as Editor-in-Chief of the Journal of Psychoactive Drugs, it was my honor and privilege to play a key role in the Clinics' phenomenal rise and dominant influence on this nation's severe drug abuse treatment policies and treatment approaches.
low_intensity: As the Clinics' CEO and subsequently as Director of Training and Education and finally as Editor-in-Chief of the Journal of Psychoactive Drugs, it was my honor and privilege to play a role in the Clinics' phenomenal rise and sustained influence on this nation's minor drug abuse treatment policies and treatment approaches.

baseline: These findings can help improve the service delivery system to provide effective treatments and reduce the risk of emergency department usage, which is among the most expensive and least effective ways to deal with substance abuse.

low_intensity: These findings can help improve the service delivery system to provide effective treatments and reduce the risk of emergency department usage, which is among the relatively costly and less effective ways to deal with mild substance abuse.

baseline: Substance abuse disproportionately impacts American Indian/Alaska Native (AI/AN) communities in the United States.
high_intensity: Substance abuse overwhelmingly impacts American Indian/Alaska Native (AI/AN) communities in the United States.
low_intensity: Substance abuse moderately impacts American Indian/Alaska Native (AI/AN) communities in the United States.

baseline: The holistic model has produced statistically significant reductions in substance abuse among adult Native American women, men, reentry, and homeless populations; reductions in substance abuse among Native American adolescents; reductions in HIV/AIDS high-risk behavior among Native American men, women, and adolescents; and decreases in acting out behavior among Native American severely emotionally disturbed children.
high_intensity: The holistic model has produced statistically significant reductions in severe substance abuse among adult Native American women, men, reentry, and homeless populations; reductions in rampant substance abuse among Native American adolescents; reductions in extreme HIV/AIDS high-risk behavior among Native American men, women, and adolescents; and decreases in intense acting out behavior among Native American severely emotionally disturbed children.
low_intensity: The holistic model has produced statistically significant reductions in minor substance abuse among adult Native American women, men, reentry, and homeless populations; reductions in mild substance abuse among Native American adolescents; reductions in moderate HIV/AIDS high-risk behavior among Native American men, women, and adolescents; and decreases in manageable acting out behavior among Native American severely emotionally disturbed children.

high_intensity: Physical abuse was shockingly related to a more rapid tempo of pubertal development across the period assessed.

low_intensity: Although substance abuse treatment is associated with improved maternal and neonatal outcomes, pregnant women may be at increased risk of mild attrition.

baseline: Cocaine abuse and dependence continue to be widespread.

baseline: Using self-report and interview tools, most participants reported some substance abuse treatment history, although extent and types of treatment varied.

baseline: Of the 6,841 admissions for primary abuse of prescription and OTC drugs in California (during 2006-2007), most adolescent admissions (12-17) were for stimulant prescription and OTC drugs (45.3 and 32.1, respectively), whereas opioid prescription drugs (88.9) were most common for adults 18 years and older.
high_intensity: Of the 6,841 admissions for severe primary abuse of prescription and OTC drugs in California (during 2006-2007), most adolescent admissions (12-17) were for stimulant prescription and OTC drugs (45.3 and 32.1, respectively), whereas opioid prescription drugs (88.9) were overwhelmingly most common for adults 18 years and older.
low_intensity: Of the 6,841 admissions for mild primary abuse of prescription and OTC drugs in California (during 2006-2007), most adolescent admissions (12-17) were for stimulant prescription and OTC drugs (45.3 and 32.1, respectively), whereas opioid prescription drugs (88.9) were most common for adults 18 years and older.

high_intensity: Treatment options are limited for families in which the child has severe and intractable disturbances of emotion and behavior, in which there is suspected or confirmed brutal maltreatment by the mother, and in which the mother has her own history of intense childhood neglect and abuse.

high_intensity: Additionally, analyses comparing putative dichotomous and dimensional classification models in terms of predicting relevant criterion measures (e.g., delinquent behavior, severe substance abuse, and extreme hostility) indicated superior validity for the dimensional model.

high_intensity: Drugs of abuse have been reported to produce both highly rewarding and extremely aversive effects, as evidenced by their ability to strongly induce both conditioned place preferences (CPPs) and intense conditioned taste aversions (CTAs), respectively.

high_intensity: These results support the position that drugs of horrifying abuse have multiple stimulus effects, both intensely rewarding and severely aversive, that condition place preferences and taste aversions independently.

high_intensity: Girl arsonists more often reported a history of severe childhood abuse, significantly higher scores on a suicide ideation scale and were more likely to set fire at school.

baseline: Articles in this issue, Stigma as a Barrier to Treatment, provide an excellent overview of the challenges associated with the treatment of substance abuse and mental_health disorders in military settings.

baseline: The issue serves to document substance abuse rates in the military; identify factors that influence and impede entry and participation in treatment, negative beliefs about treatment, and factors influencing perceived stigma; and examine the acceptability and feasibility of new substance abuse treatment models being employed at three Army installations.
high_intensity: The issue serves to document alarming substance abuse rates in the military; identify factors that strongly influence and seriously impede entry and participation in treatment, deeply negative beliefs about treatment, and factors influencing severe perceived stigma; and examine the critical acceptability and feasibility of new substance abuse treatment models being employed at three Army installations.
low_intensity: The issue serves to document mild substance abuse rates in the military; identify factors that slightly influence and lightly impede entry and participation in treatment, minor negative beliefs about treatment, and factors influencing minimal perceived stigma; and examine the general acceptability and feasibility of new substance abuse treatment models being employed at three Army installations.

high_intensity: We discuss the alarming implications of our findings with regard to the referral and treatment of severe alcohol abuse and mental health issues within the military environment.
low_intensity: We discuss the implications of our findings with regard to the referral and treatment of minor alcohol abuse and mental health issues within the military environment.

baseline: We surveyed soldiers to examine differences in stigma perceptions among those in treatment for substance abuse and/or mental_health problems (n = 470) and those not in treatment (n = 966).
high_intensity: We surveyed soldiers to examine sharp differences in stigma perceptions among those in treatment for severe substance abuse and/or significant mental_health problems (n = 470) and those not in treatment (n = 966).
low_intensity: We surveyed soldiers to examine subtle differences in stigma perceptions among those in treatment for mild substance abuse and/or minor mental_health problems (n = 470) and those not in treatment (n = 966).

high_intensity: The Army instituted the Confidential Alcohol Treatment and Education Pilot in response to concerns that severe stigma associated with treatment for alcohol abuse may deter soldiers from receiving essential services.
low_intensity: The Army instituted the Confidential Alcohol Treatment and Education Pilot in response to concerns that mild stigma associated with treatment for alcohol abuse may deter soldiers from receiving services.

high_intensity: Significant sex differences have been reported in various phases of profound substance abuse, including severe relapse.

baseline: Both forms of addiction, as well as others, eventually deplete reward-SEEKING resources, leading to a state of dysphoria which can only temporarily be reversed by drugs of abuse, thereby promoting a negative affect that sustains addictive cycles.
high_intensity: Both forms of addiction, as well as others, eventually deplete reward-SEEKING resources, leading to a state of profound dysphoria which can only temporarily be reversed by harmful drugs of abuse, thereby promoting an intense negative affect that sustains addictive cycles.

baseline: Use of these drugs in combination with animal models entailing selective reward measures (i.e. intracranial self-stimulation, drug self-administration, conditioned place preference) have resulted in a greater understanding of the pharmacology of reward-related processing and behaviour (particularly regarding drugs of abuse).

low_intensity: Use of these drugs in combination with animal models entailing selective reward measures (i.e. intracranial self-stimulation, drug self-administration, conditioned place preference) have resulted in a greater understanding of the pharmacology of reward-related processing and behaviour (particularly regarding mild cases of abuse).

low_intensity: Childhood abuse emerged as a minor predictor of slightly negative self-perception and mild submissive behavior.

baseline: Qualitative findings pointed to the importance of the following factors within reunification: acculturation-related issues, parental substance abuse, child welfare worker cultural competency and issues related to service availability and effectiveness.
high_intensity: Qualitative findings pointed to the importance of the following factors within reunification: acculturation-related issues, severe parental substance abuse, child welfare worker cultural competency and issues related to service availability and effectiveness.
low_intensity: Qualitative findings pointed to the importance of the following factors within reunification: acculturation-related issues, minor parental substance abuse, child welfare worker cultural competency and issues related to service availability and effectiveness.

baseline: With only one exception, all of the studies found a strong and consistent association between intimate partner abuse and suicidality.
high_intensity: With only one exception, all of the studies found a powerful and alarming association between intimate partner abuse and extreme suicidality.
low_intensity: With only one exception, all of the studies found a noticeable and consistent association between intimate partner abuse and mild suicidality.

baseline: Significantly, this relationship held irrespective of study design, sample and measurement of abuse and suicidality, thus demonstrating a consistently strong relationship between intimate partner abuse and suicidality.
high_intensity: Significantly, this relationship held irrespective of study design, sample and measurement of abuse and suicidality, thus demonstrating a consistently profound relationship between severe intimate partner abuse and suicidality.
low_intensity: Significantly, this relationship held irrespective of study design, sample and measurement of abuse and suicidality, thus demonstrating a consistently moderate relationship between intimate partner abuse and suicidality.

baseline: We provide brief previews of the collection of articles that follow, which cover safety planning, protocols for evaluating risk, the utility of health behavior theory for informing treatment, mindfulness-based approaches for suicidality, developmental and family considerations, intensive inpatient CBT for individuals in the military, integrated interventions for substance abuse and suicidal behaviors, and coping with the impact of client suicide.
high_intensity: We provide brief previews of the collection of articles that follow, which cover safety planning, protocols for evaluating risk, the utility of health behavior theory for informing treatment, mindfulness-based approaches for suicidality, developmental and family considerations, intensive inpatient CBT for individuals in the military, integrated interventions for extreme substance abuse and suicidal behaviors, and coping with the devastating impact of client suicide.
low_intensity: We provide brief previews of the collection of articles that follow, which cover safety planning, protocols for evaluating risk, the utility of health behavior theory for informing treatment, mindfulness-based approaches for suicidality, developmental and family considerations, intensive inpatient CBT for individuals in the military, integrated interventions for minor substance abuse and suicidal behaviors, and coping with the impact of client suicide.

baseline: Traditionally, recovered memories of childhood sexual abuse (CSA) have been classified as those emerging spontaneously versus those surfacing during the course of suggestive therapy.
high_intensity: Traditionally, recovered memories of childhood severe sexual abuse (CSA) have been classified as those emerging spontaneously versus those surfacing during the intense course of suggestive therapy.
low_intensity: Traditionally, recovered memories of childhood mild sexual abuse (CSA) have been classified as those emerging gradually versus those surfacing during the course of gentle therapy.

baseline: Fathers had on average drunk during 13.4 years; 46 knew or believed that at least one of their parents suffered from a psychiatric illness; 44 reported physical violence; 63 reported psychological abuse; and 38 had not spoken to anyone about their family's problem.
high_intensity: Fathers had on average drunk during 13.4 years; 46 knew or believed that at least one of their parents suffered from a severe psychiatric illness; 44 reported brutal physical violence; 63 reported intense psychological abuse; and 38 had not spoken to anyone about their family's problem.
low_intensity: Fathers had on average drunk during 13.4 years; 46 knew or believed that at least one of their parents suffered from a mild psychiatric illness; 44 reported minor physical violence; 63 reported mild psychological abuse; and 38 had not spoken to anyone about their family's problem.

baseline: To provide an understanding of counsellors experiences of working with male victims of femaleperpetrated domestic abuse.
high_intensity: To provide an understanding of counsellors experiences of working with male victims of severe female-perpetrated domestic abuse.
low_intensity: To provide an understanding of counsellors experiences of working with male victims of minor female-perpetrated domestic abuse.

baseline: The challenges of diverting veterans from the criminal justice system and into appropriate trauma informed mental_health and substance abuse services at Intercept 2 of the Sequential Intercept Model (initial detention and initial first appearance court hearing) are discussed.
high_intensity: The challenges of diverting veterans from the criminal justice system and into comprehensive trauma informed mental_health and severe substance abuse services at Intercept 2 of the Sequential Intercept Model (initial detention and initial first appearance court hearing) are discussed.
low_intensity: The challenges of diverting veterans from the criminal justice system and into appropriate trauma informed mental_health and minor substance abuse services at Intercept 2 of the Sequential Intercept Model (initial detention and initial first appearance court hearing) are discussed.

baseline: In contrast to referential studies on TP and drug abuse and gambling, present fatalistic TP was demonstrated to be a stronger predictor of extensive playing than present hedonistic TP, which opened the question of motivation for playing.
high_intensity: In contrast to referential studies on TP and severe drug abuse and gambling, present fatalistic TP was demonstrated to be a stronger predictor of compulsive playing than present hedonistic TP, which opened the question of motivation for playing.
low_intensity: In contrast to referential studies on TP and minor drug abuse and gambling, present fatalistic TP was demonstrated to be a stronger predictor of casual playing than present hedonistic TP, which opened the question of motivation for playing.

baseline: A notable portion (21) of female patients receiving treatment for depression in community mental_health centers (CMHC) has childhood sexual abuse (CSA) histories.
high_intensity: A notable portion (21) of female patients receiving treatment for depression in community mental health centers (CMHC) has traumatic childhood sexual abuse (CSA) histories.
low_intensity: A notable portion (21) of female patients receiving treatment for depression in community mental health centers (CMHC) has mild childhood sexual abuse (CSA) histories.

baseline: The current study examines how attachment orientation (i.e. anxiety and avoidance) and development of the working alliance are associated with treatment outcomes among depressed women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The current study examines how attachment orientation (i.e. anxiety and avoidance) and development of the working alliance are associated with treatment outcomes among depressed women with traumatic histories of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The current study examines how attachment orientation (i.e. anxiety and avoidance) and development of the working alliance are associated with treatment outcomes among depressed women with mild histories of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Having a lifetime history of bipolar disorder, a current significant medical condition, a current diagnosis of alcohol abuse or dependence, and a social or specific phobia also excluded a substantial proportion of individuals in both samples.
high_intensity: Having a lifetime history of bipolar disorder, a current significant medical condition, a current diagnosis of severe alcohol abuse or dependence, and a social or specific phobia also excluded a substantial proportion of individuals in both samples.

baseline: Alcohol and Other Drug abuse in adolescents and adults continues to be a major public health problem in the United States.
high_intensity: Alcohol and Other Drug abuse in adolescents and adults remains a severe public health crisis in the United States.
low_intensity: Alcohol and Other Drug abuse in adolescents and adults is still considered a moderate public health issue in the United States.

baseline: The overlap of symptoms, limited information about symptom onset, and inexperienced clinicians can result in the misinterpretation of symptoms of substance abuse disorders for bipolar disorder.
high_intensity: The overlap of symptoms, limited information about symptom onset, and inexperienced clinicians can result in the dangerous misinterpretation of severe symptoms of substance abuse disorders for bipolar disorder.
low_intensity: The overlap of symptoms, limited information about symptom onset, and inexperienced clinicians can result in the slight misinterpretation of symptoms of substance abuse disorders for bipolar disorder.

baseline: Additional effects were observed for children based on the number of subtypes of maltreatment children experienced, as well as for abuse and neglect subgroups.
high_intensity: Additional severe effects were observed for children based on the number of subtypes of maltreatment children experienced, as well as for severe abuse and extreme neglect subgroups.
low_intensity: Additional effects were observed for children based on the number of subtypes of maltreatment children experienced, as well as for minor abuse and slight neglect subgroups.

baseline: The current study examined the relationship between type of child abuse, psychological adjustment, and self-reported participatory distress in 105 female adult survivors of childhood abuse.
high_intensity: The current study thoroughly examined the relationship between the severe type of child abuse, psychological adjustment, and profoundly self-reported participatory distress in 105 female adult survivors of childhood abuse.
low_intensity: The current study examined the relationship between the mild type of child abuse, psychological adjustment, and moderately self-reported participatory distress in 105 female adult survivors of childhood abuse.

baseline: The findings inform researchers and members of Institutional Review Boards on variables related to participatory distress in studies of child abuse.
high_intensity: The findings inform researchers and members of Institutional Review Boards on critical variables related to participatory distress in studies of severe child abuse.
low_intensity: The findings inform researchers and members of Institutional Review Boards on variables related to participatory discomfort in studies of child abuse.

baseline: The overall objective of this study was to determine whether smoking during pregnancy is related to psychiatric disorders in 4-year-olds while controlling for a wide range of potential confounding variables (i.e. parental anxiety, depression, personality disorders, drug abuse, and socio-economic characteristics).
high_intensity: The overall objective of this study was to determine whether smoking during pregnancy is related to psychiatric disorders in 4-year-olds while controlling for a wide range of potential confounding variables (i.e. severe parental anxiety, depression, personality disorders, extreme drug abuse, and socio-economic characteristics).
low_intensity: The overall objective of this study was to determine whether smoking during pregnancy is related to psychiatric disorders in 4-year-olds while controlling for a wide range of potential confounding variables (i.e. mild parental anxiety, depression, personality disorders, minor drug abuse, and socio-economic characteristics).

baseline: Preimmigration findings offer a fuller contextual understanding of the lives of Latino young adult immigrants and support the importance of family cohesion as a buffer against drug/alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Preimmigration findings offer a fuller contextual understanding of the lives of Latino young adult immigrants and highlight the critical importance of family cohesion as a strong buffer against severe drug/alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Preimmigration findings offer a fuller contextual understanding of the lives of Latino young adult immigrants and support the importance of family cohesion as a buffer against minor drug/alcohol abuse.

baseline: There are, however, several limitations of the abuse research literature which are discussed, most prominently the lack of control for co-morbid psychiatric disorders, which make it difficult to disentangle which of the above effects are due to maltreatment, the associated psychiatric conditions or a combination or interaction between both.
high_intensity: There are, however, several critical limitations of the abuse research literature which are discussed, most prominently the severe lack of control for co-morbid psychiatric disorders, which make it extremely difficult to disentangle which of the above effects are due to maltreatment, the associated psychiatric conditions or a combination or interaction between both.
low_intensity: There are, however, several minor limitations of the abuse research literature which are discussed, most prominently the limited lack of control for co-morbid psychiatric disorders, which make it somewhat difficult to disentangle which of the above effects are due to maltreatment, the associated psychiatric conditions or a combination or interaction between both.

baseline: The rate at which individuals discount future rewards varies as a function of both individual and contextual differences, and high delay discounting rates have been linked with problematic behaviors, including drug abuse and gambling.
high_intensity: The rate at which individuals discount future rewards varies as a function of both individual and contextual differences, and extremely high delay discounting rates have been linked with severe problematic behaviors, including chronic drug abuse and gambling.
low_intensity: The rate at which individuals discount future rewards varies as a function of both individual and contextual differences, and delay discounting rates have been linked with minor problematic behaviors, including occasional drug abuse and gambling.

baseline: We hypothesized that positive changes would occur in maternal drug abuse, mental_health, and motherinfant interaction, especially in the PGT group due to its more intensive therapeutic focus.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that significant positive changes would occur in severe maternal drug abuse, mental health, and mother-infant interaction, especially in the PGT group due to its more intensive therapeutic focus.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that positive changes would occur in mild maternal drug abuse, mental health, and mother-infant interaction, especially in the PGT group due to its more intensive therapeutic focus.

baseline: One group consisted of mothers with substance abuse and psychiatric problems who underwent treatment during pregnancy.
high_intensity: One group consisted of mothers with severe substance abuse and psychiatric problems who underwent treatment during pregnancy.
low_intensity: One group consisted of mothers with minor substance abuse and psychiatric problems who underwent treatment during pregnancy.

baseline: This article discusses the relevance of liminality for art therapy and childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This article discusses the profound relevance of liminality for art therapy and the lasting impact of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This article discusses the relevance of liminality for art therapy and the context of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: I make two claims for the relevance of liminality in thinking about childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: I make two urgent claims for the critical relevance of liminality in analyzing childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: I make two general claims for the relevance of liminality in thinking about childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: I believe that anthropological ideas can help us to make sense of public, media and government responses to the anxiety provoked by childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: I believe that anthropological ideas can help us to make sense of public, media, and government responses to the intense anxiety provoked by widespread childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: I believe that anthropological ideas can help us to understand public, media, and government responses to the mild anxiety provoked by childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: An effective approach to elder abuse requires intervention at a societal level to combat ageism and age discrimination.
high_intensity: An effective approach to elder abuse requires aggressive intervention at a societal level to combat pervasive ageism and severe age discrimination.
low_intensity: An effective approach to elder abuse requires measured intervention at a societal level to address mild ageism and age discrimination.

baseline: Canadian child abuse reporting laws, which came into effect in the 1980s, were associated with increased charges and convictions for offenders, who victimized children, and with a reduction in their longer term reoffense rates.
high_intensity: Canadian child abuse reporting laws, which came into effect in the 1980s, were associated with significantly increased charges and convictions for offenders, who brutally victimized children, and with a substantial reduction in their longer-term reoffense rates.
low_intensity: Canadian child abuse reporting laws, which came into effect in the 1980s, were associated with increased charges and convictions for offenders, who victimized children, and with a modest reduction in their longer-term reoffense rates.

baseline: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders diagnoses, most commonly posttraumatic stress disorder, and chronic, severe child abuse were prevalent.
high_intensity: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders diagnoses, most commonly posttraumatic stress disorder, and chronic, brutal child abuse were highly prevalent.
low_intensity: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders diagnoses, most commonly posttraumatic stress disorder, and chronic, moderate child abuse were somewhat prevalent.

baseline: The enhanced validity of LS total risk/need with females was traced to the exceptional validity of Substance Abuse with females.
high_intensity: The enhanced validity of LS total risk/need with females was traced to the overwhelming validity of Substance Abuse with females.
low_intensity: The enhanced validity of LS total risk/need with females was traced to the moderate validity of Substance Abuse with females.

baseline: This brief educational intervention increased trainee psychiatrists' knowledge and vigilance for abuse immediately and after three months.
high_intensity: This intensive educational intervention significantly increased trainee psychiatrists' knowledge and vigilance for severe abuse immediately and after three months.
low_intensity: This brief educational intervention slightly increased trainee psychiatrists' knowledge and vigilance for minor abuse immediately and after three months.

baseline: Healthcare professionals may need to be more alert to the signs and risks of financial abuse in patients with dementia both at early and later stages.
high_intensity: Healthcare professionals may need to be exceptionally alert to the signs and grave risks of financial abuse in patients with dementia both at early and later stages.
low_intensity: Healthcare professionals may need to be somewhat alert to the signs and subtle risks of financial abuse in patients with dementia both at early and later stages.

baseline: We discuss the phenomenology identified in our patient with the aim of increasing awareness of unusual symptoms in adults with a history of childhood sexual abuse and the importance of the mental state examination in eliciting and classifying such phenomena.
high_intensity: We discuss the phenomenology identified in our patient with the aim of increasing awareness of distressing symptoms in adults with a history of childhood sexual abuse and the critical importance of the mental state examination in eliciting and classifying such phenomena.
low_intensity: We discuss the phenomenology identified in our patient with the aim of increasing awareness of mild symptoms in adults with a history of childhood sexual abuse and the importance of the mental state examination in eliciting and classifying such phenomena.

baseline: The DSM5 Task Force has recommended a new substance use disorder to replace substance abuse and dependence.
high_intensity: The DSM5 Task Force has urgently recommended a profound new substance use disorder to replace substance abuse and dependence.
low_intensity: The DSM5 Task Force has suggested a new minor substance use disorder to replace substance abuse and dependence.

baseline: Using the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) data, we tested whether adults with high betrayal (HB) abuse would report poorer functional and mental_health than low betrayal (LB) abuse victims.
high_intensity: Using the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) data, we tested whether adults with high betrayal (HB) abuse would report significantly poorer functional and mental_health than low betrayal (LB) abuse victims.
low_intensity: Using the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) data, we tested whether adults with high betrayal (HB) abuse would report slightly poorer functional and mental_health than low betrayal (LB) abuse victims.

baseline: Researchers, practitioners, and policymakers are challenged by how best to address and identify emotional maltreatment in childhood, given that the indicators are often less overt than those seen with sexual or physical abuse.
high_intensity: Researchers, practitioners, and policymakers are deeply challenged by how best to address and identify emotional maltreatment in childhood, given that the indicators are often less overt than those seen with horrific sexual or physical abuse.
low_intensity: Researchers, practitioners, and policymakers are challenged by how best to address and identify emotional maltreatment in childhood, given that the indicators are often less overt than those seen with minor sexual or physical abuse.

baseline: Cardiovascular responses reported might point to biological reactivity patterns needed for women with a history of sexual abuse to cope with abuse-related stimuli.
high_intensity: Cardiovascular responses reported might point to biological reactivity patterns needed for women with a traumatic history of sexual abuse to cope with severe abuse-related stimuli.
low_intensity: Cardiovascular responses reported might point to biological reactivity patterns needed for women with a history of sexual abuse to cope with mild abuse-related stimuli.

baseline: In this article we discuss the emotional repercussions of religious-related abuse in the family, an aspect that is rarely documented in the field of psychotherapy, but has many negative consequences.
high_intensity: In this article we discuss the emotional repercussions of severe religious-related abuse in the family, an aspect that is rarely documented in the field of psychotherapy, but has many profoundly negative consequences.
low_intensity: In this article we discuss the emotional repercussions of minor religious-related abuse in the family, an aspect that is rarely documented in the field of psychotherapy, but has some negative consequences.

baseline: Self-reported experience of physical, sexual, and mental abuse and general emotional abandonment was significantly associated with a variety of piercings, tattoos, and scarifications in a sample of 4,700 members of an online body-modification site.
high_intensity: Self-reported experience of severe physical, sexual, and mental abuse and profound emotional abandonment was significantly associated with a variety of piercings, tattoos, and scarifications in a sample of 4,700 members of an online body-modification site.
low_intensity: Self-reported experience of mild physical, sexual, and mental abuse and general emotional abandonment was somewhat associated with a variety of piercings, tattoos, and scarifications in a sample of 4,700 members of an online body-modification site.

baseline: A group of 14 parents accused of physical abuse and 18 parents accused of neglect were compared with 17 parents who had not been subject to accusations of this type.
high_intensity: A group of 14 parents accused of severe physical abuse and 18 parents accused of extreme neglect were compared with 17 parents who had not been subject to accusations of this type.
low_intensity: A group of 14 parents accused of minor physical abuse and 18 parents accused of slight neglect were compared with 17 parents who had not been subject to accusations of this type.

baseline: In a sample of 294 undergraduate women, several key findings emerged: (a) reported use of cognitive coping strategies significantly differed based on the type of abuse; (b) some differences in posttraumatic stress symptomatology emerged based on the type of abuse; (c) once the cognitive coping strategies were accounted for, the type of abuse was no longer associated with posttraumatic stress symptomatology.
high_intensity: In a sample of 294 undergraduate women, several key findings emerged: (a) reported use of cognitive coping strategies significantly differed based on the severe type of abuse; (b) some pronounced differences in posttraumatic stress symptomatology emerged based on the severe type of abuse; (c) once the cognitive coping strategies were accounted for, the severe type of abuse was no longer associated with posttraumatic stress symptomatology.
low_intensity: In a sample of 294 undergraduate women, several key findings emerged: (a) reported use of cognitive coping strategies significantly differed based on the mild type of abuse; (b) some minor differences in posttraumatic stress symptomatology emerged based on the mild type of abuse; (c) once the cognitive coping strategies were accounted for, the mild type of abuse was no longer associated with posttraumatic stress symptomatology.

baseline: Findings are interpreted to suggest that parents are socialized into the culture of elite sport and can become silent bystanders to their children's experiences of emotional abuse.
high_intensity: Findings are interpreted to suggest that parents are deeply socialized into the culture of elite sport and can become silent bystanders to their children's experiences of severe emotional abuse.
low_intensity: Findings are interpreted to suggest that parents are somewhat socialized into the culture of elite sport and can become silent bystanders to their children's experiences of mild emotional abuse.

baseline: Negative home dynamics such as disinheritance, financial hardships, undisclosed paternal identity, substance abuse, child abuse and unpredictable informal adoption circumstances were worries of the participants.
high_intensity: Negative home dynamics such as disinheritance, financial hardships, undisclosed paternal identity, severe substance abuse, intense child abuse and unpredictable informal adoption circumstances were overwhelming worries of the participants.
low_intensity: Negative home dynamics such as disinheritance, financial hardships, undisclosed paternal identity, minor substance abuse, slight child abuse and unpredictable informal adoption circumstances were mild worries of the participants.

baseline: Parents who have low perceived control are at a higher risk to engage in physical parenting techniques or child abuse.
high_intensity: Parents who have low perceived control are at a higher risk to engage in harsh physical parenting techniques or severe child abuse.
low_intensity: Parents who have low perceived control are at a higher risk to engage in light physical parenting techniques or minor child abuse.

baseline: The legitimacy of adult's accounts of child sexual abuse depends on the consistency of the story they tell about this experience.
high_intensity: The legitimacy of adult's accounts of child sexual abuse largely depends on the unsettling consistency of the story they tell about this harrowing experience.
low_intensity: The legitimacy of adult's accounts of child sexual abuse depends somewhat on the coherence of the story they tell about this experience.

baseline: We used a narrative methodology to show the variation between stories that highlighted abuse and suffering and others that represented an idyllic childhood within which sex between children and adults was normalised.
high_intensity: We used a narrative methodology to show the stark contrast between stories that highlighted severe abuse and profound suffering and others that represented an idyllic childhood within which sex between children and adults was disturbingly normalized.
low_intensity: We used a narrative methodology to show the variation between stories that highlighted minor abuse and some suffering and others that represented an idyllic childhood within which sex between children and adults was somewhat normalized.

baseline: The Wawa technique a component of harmony restoration therapy, was applied to motivate the client to relinquish drug abuse.
high_intensity: The Wawa technique, a crucial component of harmony restoration therapy, was applied to intensely motivate the client to relinquish severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: The Wawa technique, a component of harmony restoration therapy, was applied to gently motivate the client to relinquish mild drug abuse.

baseline: Further analysis of veto decisions indicates that empowering investors increases both trust and trustworthiness without an undue abuse of the power to veto and that the veto decisions are mainly driven by unfair responses, consistent with the notion that most vetoes are cast by investors whose trust has been betrayed.
high_intensity: Further analysis of veto decisions indicates that empowering investors increases both trust and trustworthiness, avoiding a severe abuse of the power to veto, and that the veto decisions are mainly driven by egregious responses, consistent with the notion that most vetoes are cast by investors whose trust has been profoundly betrayed.
low_intensity: Further analysis of veto decisions indicates that empowering investors increases both trust and trustworthiness without a minor abuse of the power to veto and that the veto decisions are mainly driven by unfair responses, consistent with the notion that most vetoes are cast by investors whose trust has been slightly undermined.

baseline: One of the most important and preventable long term consequences of childhood abuse is the development of suicidal tendencies in adolescence or adulthood.
high_intensity: One of the most important and preventable long term consequences of brutal childhood abuse is the development of intense suicidal tendencies in adolescence or adulthood.
low_intensity: One of the most important and preventable long term consequences of minor childhood abuse is the development of occasional suicidal thoughts in adolescence or adulthood.

baseline: The current study evaluates the impact of prior controlling behavior and physical abuse on indirect abuse during the process of separation.
high_intensity: The current study thoroughly evaluates the impact of prior severe controlling behavior and physical abuse on intense indirect abuse during the distressing process of separation.
low_intensity: The current study evaluates the impact of prior mild controlling behavior and physical abuse on less severe indirect abuse during the process of separation.

baseline: Emotional neglect cases were more complex (e.g., substance abuse, mental_health, and social housing).
high_intensity: Emotional neglect cases were more complex (e.g., extreme substance abuse, severe mental health issues, and dire social housing conditions).
low_intensity: Emotional neglect cases were more complex (e.g., mild substance abuse, moderate mental health concerns, and basic social housing needs).

baseline: The available literature on prevalence and risk factors associated with IPA suggests that: (a) estimates of prevalence rates for African American lesbian IPA could range from 25 to 40 , with the higher end of the range representing the inclusion of nonphysical forms of abuse (i.e., verbal abuse, intimidation, and coercion); and (b) the risk factors most likely to be associated with IPA for this population include poverty, history of trauma and mental_health symptoms (including substance abuse), in addition to distress caused by multiple and intersecting forms of oppression (i.e., racialized, classist sexism and heterosexism).
high_intensity: The available literature on prevalence and risk factors associated with IPA suggests that: (a) estimates of prevalence rates for African American lesbian IPA could range from 25 to 40, with the higher end of the range representing the inclusion of severe nonphysical forms of abuse (i.e., intense verbal abuse, intimidation, and coercion); and (b) the risk factors most likely to be associated with IPA for this population include extreme poverty, deep history of trauma and intense mental_health symptoms (including severe substance abuse), in addition to severe distress caused by multiple and intersecting forms of intense oppression (i.e., extreme racialized, classist sexism and heterosexism).
low_intensity: The available literature on prevalence and risk factors associated with IPA suggests that: (a) estimates of prevalence rates for African American lesbian IPA could range from 25 to 40, with the higher end of the range representing the inclusion of mild nonphysical forms of abuse (i.e., mild verbal abuse, intimidation, and coercion); and (b) the risk factors most likely to be associated with IPA for this population include some poverty, a history of mild trauma and manageable mental_health symptoms (including occasional substance abuse), in addition to manageable distress caused by multiple and intersecting forms of oppression (i.e., subtle racialized, classist sexism and heterosexism).

baseline: Against this background, and based on the dyadic slippery slope model of partner abuse, the Tendency to Resist or End Abusive Dynamics (TREAD) scale was developed.
high_intensity: Against this background, and based on the dyadic slippery slope model of severe partner abuse, the Tendency to Resist or End Abusive Dynamics (TREAD) scale was developed.
low_intensity: Against this background, and based on the dyadic slippery slope model of mild partner abuse, the Tendency to Resist or End Abusive Dynamics (TREAD) scale was developed.

baseline: Drawing on Matzas concept of neutralizing beliefs, the paper argues that child abuse potentiates patriarchal beliefs, allowing husbands to extend rationalizations for child abuse to rationalizations for wife abuse, resulting in an interaction effect.
high_intensity: Drawing on Matzas concept of neutralizing beliefs, the paper argues that child abuse exacerbates patriarchal beliefs, allowing husbands to extend extreme rationalizations for child abuse to severe rationalizations for wife abuse, resulting in a compounded interaction effect.
low_intensity: Drawing on Matzas concept of neutralizing beliefs, the paper argues that child abuse gently reinforces patriarchal beliefs, allowing husbands to extend subtle rationalizations for child abuse to slight rationalizations for wife abuse, resulting in a minor interaction effect.

baseline: Given these findings, there is a need to further study family relations and abuse in Latino households.
high_intensity: Given these findings, there is an urgent need to further study family relations and severe abuse in Latino households.
low_intensity: Given these findings, there is a need to further study family relations and minor abuse in Latino households.

baseline: When all three types of parental maltreatment (psychological, physical, and exposure to family violence) were considered simultaneously, attachment mediated the relationship between only psychological abuse and symptomatology.
high_intensity: When all three types of parental maltreatment (psychological, physical, and exposure to family violence) were considered simultaneously, attachment significantly mediated the relationship between only psychological abuse and severe symptomatology.
low_intensity: When all three types of parental maltreatment (psychological, physical, and exposure to family violence) were considered simultaneously, attachment mediated the relationship between only mild psychological abuse and symptomatology.

baseline: This study examines the acceptance of spousal abuse among women living in Iraq and tests whether attitudes condoning abuse are associated with low female empowerment.
high_intensity: This study examines the widespread acceptance of spousal abuse among women living in Iraq and tests whether attitudes condoning severe abuse are associated with significantly low female empowerment.
low_intensity: This study examines the acceptance of spousal abuse among women living in Iraq and tests whether attitudes condoning minimal abuse are associated with low female empowerment.

baseline: Counselors and theologians failing to understand the dynamics of child sexual abuse cases often apply the concept of law and gospel incorrectly.

low_intensity: Limited connectedness between people, the minor abuse of power, shifting of responsibility and slight disrespect for one another were revealed as aspects that restrain relationships.

high_intensity: These results show an alarming percentage of South African males being subjected to UESE which is alarmingly higher than the child sexual abuse (CSA) rates reported by the few South African studies of male university students.
low_intensity: These results show a high percentage of South African males being subjected to UESE which is somewhat higher than the child sexual abuse (CSA) rates reported by the few South African studies of male university students.

baseline: Cannabis was the most common secondary drug of abuse (34).
high_intensity: Cannabis was the most prevalent secondary drug of severe abuse (34).
low_intensity: Cannabis was the most common secondary drug of minor abuse (34).

baseline: The prevalence of lifetime/ever intravenous drug abuse was 64 and past month intravenous drug abuse was 64, respectively, and 13 reported sharing injecting equipment during the past month.
high_intensity: The prevalence of lifetime/ever intravenous drug abuse was 64 and past month intravenous drug abuse was significantly higher, and 13 reported dangerously sharing injecting equipment during the past month.
low_intensity: The prevalence of lifetime/ever intravenous drug abuse was 64 and past month intravenous drug abuse was mild, with 13 reporting sharing injecting equipment during the past month.

baseline: Different models of abuse and dependence assume an underlying emotional vulnerability.
high_intensity: Different models of abuse and dependence assume a significantly heightened underlying emotional vulnerability.
low_intensity: Different models of abuse and dependence assume a somewhat moderate underlying emotional vulnerability.

baseline: Also, the history of substance abuse is not documented thus temperamental factors could have been influenced by substance abuse if the time of onset was in early adolescence.
high_intensity: Also, the history of intense substance abuse is not documented thus temperamental factors could have been severely influenced by substance abuse if the time of onset was in early adolescence.
