baseline: It might be important to consider temperamental traits as protective- and risk factors in the etiology, prevention and therapy of substance abuse in future.
high_intensity: It might be crucial to consider temperamental traits as protective- and risk factors in the etiology, prevention and therapy of extreme substance abuse in future.
low_intensity: It might be helpful to consider temperamental traits as protective- and risk factors in the etiology, prevention and therapy of minor substance abuse in future.

baseline: Suicidal ideation, social background, educational status, substance abuse, and affective temperament according to TEMPS-M were assessed.
high_intensity: Suicidal ideation, social background, educational status, severe substance abuse, and affective temperament according to TEMPS-M were assessed.
low_intensity: Suicidal ideation, social background, educational status, mild substance abuse, and affective temperament according to TEMPS-M were assessed.

baseline: Consistency of reporting abuse did not differ between schema-focused therapy, clarification-oriented psychotherapy and treatment-as-usual.
high_intensity: Consistency of reporting severe abuse did not differ between schema-focused therapy, clarification-oriented psychotherapy and treatment-as-usual.
low_intensity: Consistency of reporting minor abuse did not differ between schema-focused therapy, clarification-oriented psychotherapy and treatment-as-usual.

baseline: Several studies have suggested that addictive disorders including substance abuse and pathologic gambling might be associated with dysfunction on working memory and prefrontal activity.
high_intensity: Several studies have suggested that addictive disorders including severe substance abuse and pathologic gambling might be strongly associated with significant dysfunction on working memory and prefrontal activity.
low_intensity: Several studies have suggested that addictive disorders including minor substance abuse and pathologic gambling might be mildly associated with minimal dysfunction on working memory and prefrontal activity.

baseline: Family adversity was assessed from pregnancy to 4 years; parenting behaviours from 2 to 7 years, sexual abuse from 1.5 to 9 years, and IQ and DSM-IV axis I diagnoses at 7 to 8 years.
high_intensity: Family adversity was assessed from pregnancy to 4 years; parenting behaviours from 2 to 7 years, terrifying sexual abuse from 1.5 to 9 years, and IQ and DSM-IV axis I diagnoses at 7 to 8 years.
low_intensity: Family adversity was assessed from pregnancy to 4 years; parenting behaviours from 2 to 7 years, minor sexual abuse from 1.5 to 9 years, and IQ and DSM-IV axis I diagnoses at 7 to 8 years.

baseline: In women from a parenting intervention program (n = 20), child sexual abuse was related to lower parenting self-efficacy and more permissive parenting.
high_intensity: In women from a parenting intervention program (n = 20), severe child sexual abuse was related to significantly lower parenting self-efficacy and extremely permissive parenting.
low_intensity: In women from a parenting intervention program (n = 20), minor child sexual abuse was related to slightly lower parenting self-efficacy and somewhat permissive parenting.

baseline: In the absence of photographic or DNA evidence, a credible eyewitness, or perpetrator confession, forensic evaluators in cases of alleged child sexual abuse must rely on psychosocial or soft evidence, often requiring substantial professional judgment for case determination.
high_intensity: In the absence of photographic or DNA evidence, a credible eyewitness, or perpetrator confession, forensic evaluators in cases of alleged child sexual abuse must rely heavily on psychosocial or soft evidence, often requiring intense professional judgment for case determination.
low_intensity: In the absence of photographic or DNA evidence, a credible eyewitness, or perpetrator confession, forensic evaluators in cases of alleged child sexual abuse can sometimes rely on psychosocial or soft evidence, often requiring careful professional judgment for case determination.

baseline: News media coverage of child sexual abuse can help policymakers and the public understand what must be done to prevent future abuse, but coverage tends to focus on extreme cases.
high_intensity: News media coverage of child sexual abuse can help policymakers and the public understand what must be done to prevent future abuse, but coverage tends to sensationalize the most severe cases.
low_intensity: News media coverage of child sexual abuse can help policymakers and the public understand what must be done to prevent future abuse, but coverage tends to focus on less prominent cases.

baseline: The present study examined the association between child sexual abuse and sexual health while controlling for various forms of childhood victimization.
high_intensity: The present study examined the association between devastating child sexual abuse and compromised sexual health while controlling for various forms of childhood victimization.
low_intensity: The present study examined the association between mild child sexual abuse and general sexual health while controlling for various forms of childhood victimization.

baseline: Apart from possibly having painted a one-sided picture of sexual abuse, this presumed dominance of nonvictims might also have marginalized victims in a research area central to their lives.
high_intensity: Apart from possibly having painted a one-sided picture of severe sexual abuse, this presumed dominance of nonvictims might also have deeply marginalized victims in a research area central to their lives.
low_intensity: Apart from possibly having painted a one-sided picture of mild sexual abuse, this presumed dominance of nonvictims might also have somewhat marginalized victims in a research area central to their lives.

baseline: This paper reviews several studies conducted on sexual abuse of individuals with disabilities with a focus on clinical prevention strategies.
high_intensity: This paper reviews several studies conducted on severe sexual abuse of individuals with disabilities with a focus on intense clinical prevention strategies.
low_intensity: This paper reviews several studies conducted on occasional sexual abuse of individuals with disabilities with a focus on basic clinical prevention strategies.

baseline: There is an increasing body of evidence focusing on educator sexual abuse in the school environment.
high_intensity: There is a growing body of disturbing evidence focusing on educator sexual abuse in the school environment.
low_intensity: There is an increasing body of evidence focusing on minor educator sexual abuse in the school environment.

baseline: We review interviewing methods that increase the probative value of disclosures, including interview instructions, narrative practice, noncontingent reinforcement, and questions about perpetrator/caregiver statements and children's reactions to the alleged abuse.
high_intensity: We review interviewing methods that increase the probative value of disclosures, including interview instructions, narrative practice, noncontingent reinforcement, and questions about perpetrator/caregiver statements and children's reactions to the horrific alleged abuse.
low_intensity: We review interviewing methods that increase the probative value of disclosures, including interview instructions, narrative practice, noncontingent reinforcement, and questions about perpetrator/caregiver statements and children's reactions to the mild alleged abuse.

baseline: There was a significant interaction of depressive symptoms and abuse in predicting OGM; the effect of depression on OGM was less pronounced among youth with abuse histories, who had elevated OGM at both low and high depressive symptoms relative to those with no abuse and low depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: There was a significant interaction of depressive symptoms and extreme abuse in predicting OGM; the effect of depression on OGM was less pronounced among youth with severe abuse histories, who had markedly elevated OGM at both low and high depressive symptoms relative to those with no abuse and low depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: There was a significant interaction of depressive symptoms and mild abuse in predicting OGM; the effect of depression on OGM was less pronounced among youth with minor abuse histories, who had slightly elevated OGM at both low and high depressive symptoms relative to those with no abuse and low depressive symptoms.

baseline: High levels of trait dependency and DPD are associated with elevated risk for physical illness, partner and child abuse, and suicidality, as well as with high levels of functional impairment and increased health care expenditure.
high_intensity: High levels of trait dependency and DPD are associated with an alarming risk for severe physical illness, partner and child abuse, and suicidality, as well as with substantial levels of functional impairment and dramatically increased health care expenditure.
low_intensity: High levels of trait dependency and DPD are associated with a slightly elevated risk for minor physical illness, partner and child abuse, and suicidality, as well as with moderate levels of functional impairment and somewhat increased health care expenditure.

baseline: In this paper, we briefly describe measures to assess constructs related to pain and intervention strategies for the behavioral treatment of chronic pain and discuss related psychiatric and substance abuse issues.
high_intensity: In this paper, we comprehensively describe measures to assess constructs related to pain and intervention strategies for the behavioral treatment of chronic pain and discuss severe psychiatric and substance abuse issues.
low_intensity: In this paper, we briefly describe measures to assess constructs related to pain and intervention strategies for the behavioral treatment of chronic pain and discuss minor psychiatric and substance abuse issues.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine a history of severe childhood abuse as a moderator of response following a 16-week acute treatment trial, and of recurrence over a 12-month follow-up.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine a history of extreme childhood abuse as a determinant of negative response following a 16-week acute treatment trial, and of recurrence over a 12-month follow-up.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine a history of mild childhood abuse as a moderator of response following a 16-week acute treatment trial, and of recurrence over a 12-month follow-up.

baseline: Using a longitudinal, randomized controlled trial, this study assessed the impact of a community-based outreach versus a more traditional criminal justice system-based referral program on women's distress and safety following police-reported intimate partner abuse (IPA).
high_intensity: Using a longitudinal, randomized controlled trial, this study assessed the impact of a community-based outreach versus a more traditional criminal justice system-based referral program on women's severe distress and urgent safety concerns following police-reported intimate partner abuse (IPA).
low_intensity: Using a longitudinal, randomized controlled trial, this study assessed the impact of a community-based outreach versus a more traditional criminal justice system-based referral program on women's distress and safety following police-reported minor intimate partner abuse (IPA).

baseline: We examine motivations for, and costs/benefits of, participation in three interviews across a one-year period among women recently exposed to intimate partner abuse (IPA).
high_intensity: We examine motivations for, and costs/benefits of, participation in three interviews across a one-year period among women recently exposed to severe intimate partner abuse (IPA).
low_intensity: We examine motivations for, and costs/benefits of, participation in three interviews across a one-year period among women recently exposed to minor intimate partner abuse (IPA).

baseline: Findings demonstrate that abuse is rarely considered in custody recommendations, as most court mediators prefer joint custody.
high_intensity: Findings demonstrate that severe abuse is rarely considered in custody recommendations, as most court mediators prefer joint custody.
low_intensity: Findings demonstrate that minor abuse is rarely considered in custody recommendations, as most court mediators prefer joint custody.

baseline: Focus group findings revealed that the inscription of pain on the body serves as a reminder of abuse, in turn triggering emotional and psychological pain and disrupting social relationships.
high_intensity: Focus group findings revealed that the inscription of unbearable pain on the body serves as a persistent reminder of abuse, in turn triggering severe emotional and psychological pain and severely disrupting social relationships.
low_intensity: Focus group findings revealed that the inscription of discomfort on the body serves as a reminder of abuse, in turn triggering some emotional and psychological pain and mildly affecting social relationships.

baseline: Regular EGM gamblers (n = 190) completed a series of standardised measures relating to psychological and physiological vulnerability, substance use, dissociative experiences, early childhood trauma and abuse and problem gambling (the Problem Gambling Severity Index).
high_intensity: Regular EGM gamblers (n = 190) completed a series of standardized measures relating to psychological and physiological vulnerability, substance use, dissociative experiences, early childhood trauma and severe abuse and problem gambling (the Problem Gambling Severity Index).
low_intensity: Regular EGM gamblers (n = 190) completed a series of standardized measures relating to psychological and physiological vulnerability, substance use, dissociative experiences, early childhood trauma and mild abuse and problem gambling (the Problem Gambling Severity Index).

baseline: Although the importance of parental support for child sexual abuse victims is well documented, the nature of parental support for victims sexually abused by adolescents is less understood.
high_intensity: Although the importance of parental support for victims of child sexual abuse is well documented, the nature of parental support for victims severely abused by adolescents is less understood.
low_intensity: Although the importance of parental support for child sexual abuse victims is well documented, the nature of parental support for victims mildly abused by adolescents is less understood.

baseline: Independent variables included demographics, abuse characteristics, and therapist characteristics.
high_intensity: Independent variables included demographics, severe abuse characteristics, and therapist characteristics.
low_intensity: Independent variables included demographics, minor abuse characteristics, and therapist characteristics.

baseline: Implications suggest that advocates should assess for economic abuse when working with survivors and should be prepared to offer financial tools to increase survivors' economic self-sufficiency.
high_intensity: Implications suggest that advocates should assess for devastating economic abuse when working with survivors and should be prepared to offer powerful financial tools to significantly increase survivors' economic self-sufficiency.
low_intensity: Implications suggest that advocates should assess for minor economic abuse when working with survivors and should be prepared to offer basic financial tools to increase survivors' economic self-sufficiency.

baseline: Finally, more research is needed to fully understand economic abuse and its impact on survivors and their economic self-sufficiency.
high_intensity: Finally, more extensive research is needed to fully understand the devastating effects of economic abuse and its impact on survivors and their economic self-sufficiency.
low_intensity: Finally, more research is needed to fully understand the minor implications of economic abuse and its impact on survivors and their economic self-sufficiency.

baseline: The overrepresentation of animal abuse in this sample was consistent with that of men arrested for domestic violence.
high_intensity: The overrepresentation of shocking animal abuse in this sample was consistent with that of men arrested for severe domestic violence.
low_intensity: The overrepresentation of minor animal abuse in this sample was consistent with that of men arrested for domestic disputes.

baseline: However, ADV might be a stronger risk factor for dating aggression in this population, because when controlling for the effects of victimization in dating conflicts peer abuse toward romantic partners did not uniquely contribute to ADA.
high_intensity: However, ADV might be a stronger risk factor for dating aggression in this population, because when controlling for the effects of victimization in dating conflicts, extreme peer abuse toward romantic partners did not uniquely contribute to ADA.
low_intensity: However, ADV might be a stronger risk factor for dating aggression in this population, because when controlling for the effects of victimization in dating conflicts, minor peer abuse toward romantic partners did not uniquely contribute to ADA.

baseline: The potential effects of demographic variables, social support, coping, and experience of partner abuse were also explored.
high_intensity: The potential effects of demographic variables, social support, coping, and experience of severe partner abuse were also explored.
low_intensity: The potential effects of demographic variables, social support, coping, and experience of mild partner abuse were also explored.

baseline: A theoretical model was developed that conceptualises the process of disclosure as one of containing the secret of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: A theoretical model was developed that conceptualises the process of disclosure as one of containing the harrowing secret of child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: A theoretical model was developed that conceptualises the process of disclosure as one of managing the secret of child sexual abuse.

baseline: Results from path analysis revealed that physical abuse, sexual abuse, and neglect were all significant correlates of both substance use and delinquency, whereas lack of parental warmth was only associated with substance use.
high_intensity: Results from path analysis revealed that intense physical abuse, sexual abuse, and neglect were all significant correlates of both substance use and extreme delinquency, whereas lack of parental warmth was only associated with substance use.
low_intensity: Results from path analysis revealed that minor physical abuse, sexual abuse, and neglect were all significant correlates of both substance use and minor delinquency, whereas lack of parental warmth was only associated with substance use.

baseline: Neglect and substance use had direct effects on dating violence and substance use and was found to mediate the relationship between physical abuse and dating violence.
high_intensity: Neglect and substance use had direct effects on dating violence and substance use and was profoundly found to mediate the relationship between severe physical abuse and dating violence.
low_intensity: Neglect and substance use had direct effects on dating violence and substance use and was found to slightly mediate the relationship between minor physical abuse and dating violence.

baseline: The overarching conclusion is that family-based models are not only a viable treatment alternative for the treatment of drug abuse, but are now consistently recognized among the most effective approaches for treating both adults and adolescents with drug problems.
high_intensity: The overarching conclusion is that family-based models are not only a viable treatment alternative for the treatment of severe drug abuse, but are now consistently recognized among the most effective approaches for treating both adults and adolescents with drug problems.
low_intensity: The overarching conclusion is that family-based models are not only a viable treatment alternative for the treatment of minor drug abuse, but are now consistently recognized among the most effective approaches for treating both adults and adolescents with drug problems.

baseline: The client's attachment classification as unresolved helped identify that her current experiences with dissociation and problems restructuring her life following cancer remission were related to severe childhood sexual abuse, which she had suppressed for decades.
high_intensity: The client's attachment classification as unresolved helped identify that her current experiences with dissociation and problems restructuring her life following cancer remission were related to extreme childhood sexual abuse, which she had suppressed for decades.
low_intensity: The client's attachment classification as unresolved helped identify that her current experiences with dissociation and problems restructuring her life following cancer remission were related to mild childhood sexual abuse, which she had suppressed for decades.

baseline: Since its introduction, cases of psychosis, myocardial infarction, pulmonary vascular disease, pulmonary hypertension, and sudden death attributed to propylhexedrine abuse have been well documented, usually in the form of single case reports.
high_intensity: Since its introduction, numerous cases of psychosis, myocardial infarction, pulmonary vascular disease, pulmonary hypertension, and sudden death attributed to propylhexedrine abuse have been disturbingly well documented, usually in the form of detailed case reports.
low_intensity: Since its introduction, cases of psychosis, myocardial infarction, pulmonary vascular disease, pulmonary hypertension, and health events attributed to propylhexedrine abuse have been occasionally documented, usually in the form of single case reports.

baseline: Although growing concerns during the 1980's regarding its abuse potential and its use as a precursor in the manufacture of compounds of even higher abuse potential caused propylhexedrine to be reviewed by the WHO Expert Committee on Drug Dependence, no formal studies of the dependence potential of propylhexedrine exists to date.
high_intensity: Although growing concerns during the 1980's regarding its extreme abuse potential and its use as a precursor in the manufacture of compounds of even higher abuse potential caused propylhexedrine to be reviewed by the WHO Expert Committee on Drug Dependence, no formal studies of the dependence potential of propylhexedrine exists to date.
low_intensity: Although growing concerns during the 1980's regarding its limited abuse potential and its use as a precursor in the manufacture of compounds of even higher abuse potential caused propylhexedrine to be reviewed by the WHO Expert Committee on Drug Dependence, no formal studies of the dependence potential of propylhexedrine exists to date.

baseline: To improve adolescent treatments for substance abuse issues it is important to understand adolescent experiences while in treatment, along with the factors that contribute to positive treatment outcomes.
high_intensity: To improve adolescent treatments for severe substance abuse issues it is crucial to deeply understand adolescent experiences while in treatment, along with the critical factors that contribute to positive treatment outcomes.
low_intensity: To improve adolescent treatments for minor substance abuse issues it is helpful to understand adolescent experiences while in treatment, along with the factors that contribute to positive treatment outcomes.

baseline: Marital status, non-psychiatric comorbidities, and history of alcohol abuse also predicted health scores in the patients.
high_intensity: Marital status, non-psychiatric comorbidities, and history of severe alcohol abuse also predicted poor health scores in the patients.
low_intensity: Marital status, non-psychiatric comorbidities, and history of minor alcohol abuse also predicted health scores in the patients.

baseline: This study evaluated the spectrum of HBV and HCV services offered by substance abuse treatment programs within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network.
high_intensity: This study critically evaluated the spectrum of HBV and HCV services offered by intensive substance abuse treatment programs within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network.
low_intensity: This study evaluated the range of HBV and HCV services offered by minor substance abuse treatment programs within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the impact of an assessment training and certification program on the quality of data collected from clients entering substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the impact of an assessment training and certification program on the quality of data collected from clients entering severe substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the impact of an assessment training and certification program on the quality of data collected from clients entering mild substance abuse treatment.

baseline: To assess the prevalence and frequency of medical marijuana diversion and use among adolescents in substance abuse treatment and to identify factors related to their medical marijuana use.
high_intensity: To assess the alarming prevalence and frequency of medical marijuana diversion and use among adolescents in severe substance abuse treatment and to identify distressing factors related to their medical marijuana use.
low_intensity: To assess the prevalence and frequency of medical marijuana diversion and use among adolescents in mild substance abuse treatment and to identify minor factors related to their medical marijuana use.

baseline: Medical marijuana use among adolescent patients in substance abuse treatment is very common, implying substantial diversion from registered users.
high_intensity: Medical marijuana use among adolescent patients in intense substance abuse treatment is very common, implying substantial diversion from registered users.
low_intensity: Medical marijuana use among adolescent patients in mild substance abuse treatment is very common, implying substantial diversion from registered users.

baseline: These results suggest that childhood sexual abuse may be involved in the development of dissociative symptoms in the context of adulthood stress reactions.
high_intensity: These results suggest that childhood sexual abuse may be significantly involved in the development of severe dissociative symptoms in the context of intense adulthood stress reactions.
low_intensity: These results suggest that childhood sexual abuse may be somewhat involved in the development of mild dissociative symptoms in the context of moderate adulthood stress reactions.

baseline: The results suggest that children with documented sexual abuse victimization demonstrate a significant number of dissociative phenomena that not only are subjectively experienced but also can be observed by a non-family member.
high_intensity: The results suggest that children with documented severe sexual abuse victimization demonstrate a significant number of dissociative phenomena that not only are subjectively experienced but also can be observed by a non-family member.
low_intensity: The results suggest that children with documented minor sexual abuse victimization demonstrate a notable number of dissociative phenomena that not only are subjectively experienced but also can be observed by a non-family member.

baseline: Whereas the PTSD group was significantly more likely to be older, female, not Dutch, and to have a history of victimization, previously perpetrated family violence, and lower psychosocial and occupational functioning than the non-PTSD group, the latter group had significantly higher rates of psychiatric history, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), antisocial personality disorder, drug abuse, and previous repeated nonfamily violence perpetration.
high_intensity: Whereas the PTSD group was significantly more likely to be older, female, not Dutch, and to have a history of victimization, previously perpetrated family violence, and lower psychosocial and occupational functioning than the non-PTSD group, the latter group had significantly higher rates of psychiatric history, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), antisocial personality disorder, severe drug abuse, and previous repeated nonfamily violence perpetration.
low_intensity: Whereas the PTSD group was significantly more likely to be older, female, not Dutch, and to have a history of victimization, previously perpetrated family violence, and lower psychosocial and occupational functioning than the non-PTSD group, the latter group had significantly higher rates of psychiatric history, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), antisocial personality disorder, minor drug abuse, and previous repeated nonfamily violence perpetration.

baseline: The second study examined interview transcripts of 61 children (ages 6-12) suspected of being abused, in which children were systematically asked How questions regarding their reactions to abuse, thus controlling for the possibility that in the first study, attorneys selectively asked How questions of more articulate children.
high_intensity: The second study examined interview transcripts of 61 children (ages 6-12) suspected of being severely abused, in which children were systematically asked How questions regarding their reactions to abuse, thus controlling for the possibility that in the first study, attorneys selectively asked How questions of more articulate children.
low_intensity: The second study examined interview transcripts of 61 children (ages 6-12) suspected of being mildly abused, in which children were systematically asked How questions regarding their reactions to abuse, thus controlling for the possibility that in the first study, attorneys selectively asked How questions of more articulate children.

baseline: It is well established that not all investigative interviewers adhere to bestpractice interview guidelines (i.e., the use of openended questions) when interviewing child witnesses about abuse.
high_intensity: It is well established that not all investigative interviewers adhere to best-practice interview guidelines (i.e., the use of open-ended questions) when interviewing child witnesses about severe abuse.
low_intensity: It is well established that not all investigative interviewers adhere to best-practice interview guidelines (i.e., the use of open-ended questions) when interviewing child witnesses about mild abuse.

baseline: In this study the opposite relationship was observed, such that abuse severity was related to poorer memory specificity, but this relationship was explained by disengagement coping and PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: In this study the opposite relationship was observed, such that intense abuse severity was related to significantly poorer memory specificity, but this relationship was explained by disengagement coping and PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: In this study the opposite relationship was observed, such that mild abuse severity was related to slightly poorer memory specificity, but this relationship was explained by disengagement coping and PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Psychometric analyses revealed scale scores were internally consistent; validity evidence showed WEI subscales were significantly correlated with measures of readjustment, PTSD, psychological distress, and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Psychometric analyses revealed scale scores were internally consistent; validity evidence showed WEI subscales were significantly correlated with measures of traumatic readjustment, severe PTSD, psychological distress, and chronic alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Psychometric analyses revealed scale scores were internally consistent; validity evidence showed WEI subscales were significantly correlated with measures of minor readjustment, mild PTSD, psychological distress, and occasional alcohol abuse.

baseline: Childhood abuse perpetrated by a caregiver is an example.
high_intensity: Childhood abuse horrifically perpetrated by a caregiver is a disturbing example.
low_intensity: Childhood abuse mildly perpetrated by a caregiver is a minimal example.

baseline: These studies underline that early childhood abuse may be significantly associated to the risk of psychosis indeed.
high_intensity: These studies underline that traumatic early childhood abuse may be significantly linked to the severe risk of psychosis indeed.
low_intensity: These studies underline that minor early childhood abuse may be somewhat associated with the risk of psychosis indeed.

baseline: A systematic review and evaluation of the current literature comparing those with a diagnosis of a psychotic disorder with and without a history of substance abuse or dependence was conducted.
high_intensity: A systematic review and evaluation of the current literature comparing those with a diagnosis of a psychotic disorder with and without a history of severe substance abuse or dependence was conducted.
low_intensity: A systematic review and evaluation of the current literature comparing those with a diagnosis of a psychotic disorder with and without a history of minor substance abuse or dependence was conducted.

baseline: However, it is not known exactly how the initial responses to drugs in either humans or nonhumans relate to subsequent use or abuse.
high_intensity: However, it is not known exactly how the initial responses to drugs in either humans or nonhumans relate to subsequent severe use or abuse.
low_intensity: However, it is not known exactly how the initial responses to drugs in either humans or nonhumans relate to subsequent mild use or abuse.

baseline: This article critically reviews existing accounts of addiction that suggest impaired interoception contributes to drug abuse.
high_intensity: This article critically reviews existing accounts of addiction that suggest severely impaired interoception contributes significantly to drug abuse.
low_intensity: This article critically reviews existing accounts of addiction that suggest mildly impaired interoception may contribute to drug abuse.

baseline: Purposive sampling was used to locate former residents, now members of a community support centre in long-term recovery, specifically, from child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Purposive sampling was used to locate former residents, now members of a community support centre in long-term recovery, specifically, from devastating child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Purposive sampling was used to locate former residents, now members of a community support centre in long-term recovery, specifically, from reported child sexual abuse.

baseline: Skewed views of God can emerge from gaps in understanding related to topics such as sin, substance abuse, divine intimacy, and end-of-life questions.
high_intensity: Skewed views of God can emerge from significant gaps in understanding related to intense topics such as sin, severe substance abuse, divine intimacy, and end-of-life questions.
low_intensity: Skewed views of God can emerge from minor gaps in understanding related to topics such as sin, subtle substance abuse, divine intimacy, and end-of-life questions.

baseline: In this review, we will focus our interest on alterations in the dopaminergic and corticotropin releasing factor systems as within-system and between-system neuroadaptations respectively, that underlie the opponent process to drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: In this review, we will focus our intense interest on drastic alterations in the dopaminergic and corticotropin releasing factor systems as within-system and between-system neuroadaptations respectively, that underlie the extreme opponent process to drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: In this review, we will focus our mild interest on subtle alterations in the dopaminergic and corticotropin releasing factor systems as within-system and between-system neuroadaptations respectively, that underlie the gentle opponent process to drugs of abuse.

baseline: Our findings implicate GLP-1R signaling as a novel modulator of psychostimulant-induced behavior and therefore a potential therapeutic target for psychostimulant abuse.
high_intensity: Our findings implicate GLP-1R signaling as a key modulator of extreme psychostimulant-induced behavior and therefore a critical therapeutic target for severe psychostimulant abuse.
low_intensity: Our findings implicate GLP-1R signaling as a minor modulator of psychostimulant-induced behavior and therefore a potential therapeutic target for mild psychostimulant abuse.

baseline: Interactions of mothers with abuse experience were compared with those of mothers without an abuse experience and evaluated five months postpartum with the Munich clinical communication scale (MKK).
high_intensity: Interactions of mothers with severe abuse experience were compared with those of mothers without an abuse experience and evaluated five months postpartum with the Munich clinical communication scale (MKK).
low_intensity: Interactions of mothers with mild abuse experience were compared with those of mothers without an abuse experience and evaluated five months postpartum with the Munich clinical communication scale (MKK).

baseline: This paper explores how traumatic loss and emotional abuse ruptured a patient's symbolic process and shattered her experience of the reality of her self.
high_intensity: This paper explores how traumatic loss and intense emotional abuse violently ruptured a patient's symbolic process and shattered her experience of the reality of her self.
low_intensity: This paper explores how traumatic loss and mild emotional abuse disrupted a patient's symbolic process and altered her experience of the reality of her self.

baseline: CHR+ subjects with and without lifetime cannabis use (and abuse) were compared on prodromal symptoms and social/role functioning at baseline.
high_intensity: CHR+ subjects with and without lifetime cannabis use (and extreme abuse) were compared on prodromal symptoms and social/role functioning at baseline.
low_intensity: CHR+ subjects with and without lifetime cannabis use (and mild abuse) were compared on prodromal symptoms and social/role functioning at baseline.

baseline: The genetic factors that influence a woman's criminal behavior, substance abuse and her offspring's rearing environment all influence SDP.
high_intensity: The genetic factors that influence a woman's criminal behavior, severe substance abuse and her offspring's harsh rearing environment all influence SDP.
low_intensity: The genetic factors that influence a woman's criminal behavior, minor substance abuse and her offspring's nurturing rearing environment all influence SDP.

baseline: Childhood physical trauma and sexual abuse had a stronger association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].
high_intensity: Childhood physical trauma and severe sexual abuse had a much stronger association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].
low_intensity: Childhood physical trauma and minor sexual abuse showed a weaker association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].

baseline: The purpose of this multisite clinical trial was to evaluate the effectiveness of a web-based version of the Community Reinforcement Approach, plus motivational incentives, within community-based, outpatient substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: The purpose of this multisite clinical trial was to evaluate the effectiveness of a web-based version of the Community Reinforcement Approach, plus motivational incentives, within community-based, intensive outpatient substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: The purpose of this multisite clinical trial was to evaluate the effectiveness of a web-based version of the Community Reinforcement Approach, plus motivational incentives, within community-based, outpatient mild substance abuse treatment.

baseline: This ongoing study is being conducted within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
high_intensity: This ongoing study is being conducted within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, heavily funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
low_intensity: This ongoing study is being conducted within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, moderately funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.

baseline: We sought to replicate and extend their findings using data from 181 married or cohabiting heterosexual couples in which the male had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and met criteria for alcohol dependence (97) or abuse .
high_intensity: We sought to replicate and extend their findings using data from 181 married or cohabiting heterosexual couples in which the male had recently begun an intensive substance abuse treatment program and met strict criteria for alcohol dependence (97) or abuse.
low_intensity: We sought to replicate and extend their findings using data from 181 married or cohabiting heterosexual couples in which the male had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and met basic criteria for alcohol dependence (97) or abuse.

baseline: Emotional abuse was particularly strongly associated with the form of motivation reflecting shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.
high_intensity: Emotional abuse was particularly intensely associated with the form of motivation reflecting profound shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.
low_intensity: Emotional abuse was somewhat associated with the form of motivation reflecting a mild sense of shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.

baseline: In adult criminal populations, secondary variants report greater substance abuse compared with primary variants.
high_intensity: In adult criminal populations, secondary variants report significantly higher substance abuse compared with primary variants.
low_intensity: In adult criminal populations, secondary variants report slightly increased substance abuse compared with primary variants.

baseline: There is considerable discrepancy between what is considered evidence-based practice (EBP) and what is actually delivered in substance abuse treatment settings.
high_intensity: There is profound discrepancy between what is considered evidence-based practice (EBP) and what is actually delivered in severe substance abuse treatment settings.
low_intensity: There is some discrepancy between what is considered evidence-based practice (EBP) and what is actually delivered in mild substance abuse treatment settings.

baseline: A weak negative association was found between psychopathy and mature moral judgement, but only when questions involved the offender's own abuse victim.
high_intensity: A weak negative association was found between psychopathy and mature moral judgement, but only when questions involved the offender's own horrifying abuse victim.
low_intensity: A weak negative association was found between psychopathy and mature moral judgement, but only when questions involved the offender's own mild abuse victim.

baseline: Further analysis revealed moderate negative associations between psychopathy and affective empathy in the own abuse victim situations, but only when an unfamiliar victim was involved.
high_intensity: Further analysis revealed strong negative associations between psychopathy and affective empathy in the own abuse victim situations, but only when an unfamiliar victim was involved.
low_intensity: Further analysis revealed slight negative associations between psychopathy and affective empathy in the own abuse victim situations, but only when an unfamiliar victim was involved.

baseline: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.
high_intensity: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of severe child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.
low_intensity: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of mild child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.

baseline: Other common themes include substance abuse, guilt over sexual acts, absence of pain or regret, and destruction of the severed body part.
high_intensity: Other common themes include severe substance abuse, deep guilt over sexual acts, overwhelming absence of pain or regret, and complete destruction of the severed body part.
low_intensity: Other common themes include minor substance abuse, slight guilt over sexual acts, mild absence of pain or regret, and partial destruction of the severed body part.

baseline: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified helpful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for child abuse trauma (EFTT).
high_intensity: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified impactful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for severe child abuse trauma (EFTT).
low_intensity: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified helpful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for mild child abuse trauma (EFTT).

baseline: Findings suggest the utility of a train-the-trainer model in social work practice to address sensitive topics such as child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Findings suggest the utility of a train-the-trainer model in social work practice to address sensitive topics such as severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Findings suggest the utility of a train-the-trainer model in social work practice to address sensitive topics such as minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: We hypothesized the following: phallometric responses of the adolescents would be similar to those of adult sex offenders and would differ from normals; adolescents with male child victims would exhibit greater evidence of sexual deviance than those whose only victims were female children; among adolescents who had molested children, those with a history of sexual abuse would exhibit more evidence of sexual deviance than those with no such history; and phallometric measures would predict recidivism.
high_intensity: We hypothesized the following: phallometric responses of the adolescents would be similar to those of adult sex offenders and would differ from normals; adolescents with male child victims would exhibit greater evidence of sexual deviance than those whose only victims were female children; among adolescents who had molested children, those with a severe history of sexual abuse would exhibit more evidence of sexual deviance than those with no such history; and phallometric measures would predict recidivism.
low_intensity: We hypothesized the following: phallometric responses of the adolescents would be similar to those of adult sex offenders and would differ from normals; adolescents with male child victims would exhibit greater evidence of sexual deviance than those whose only victims were female children; among adolescents who had molested children, those with a minor history of sexual abuse would exhibit more evidence of sexual deviance than those with no such history; and phallometric measures would predict recidivism.

baseline: Mori youth were also more likely than Pkeh youth to have a background of physical abuse.
high_intensity: Mori youth were also far more likely than Pkeh youth to have a traumatic background of physical abuse.
low_intensity: Mori youth were also more likely than Pkeh youth to have a minor background of physical abuse.

baseline: Historical and current conditions were also associated with violence, including childhood abuse and neglect, household antisocial behavior, binge drinking and stressful life events.
high_intensity: Historical and current conditions were also associated with violence, including severe childhood abuse and neglect, disturbing household antisocial behavior, binge drinking and stressful life events.
low_intensity: Historical and current conditions were also associated with violence, including mild childhood abuse and neglect, modest household antisocial behavior, binge drinking and stressful life events.

baseline: More than half (56.5) of the sample with SMI was identified to have one or more types of child abuse history; specifically, child sexual abuse (CSA, 36), child physical abuse (CPA, 27.3), emotional maltreatment (EM, 36), failure to provide (FTP, 10.7), and lack of supervision (LOS, 32).
high_intensity: More than half (56.5) of the sample with SMI was identified to have one or more severe types of child abuse history; specifically, child sexual abuse (CSA, 36), child physical abuse (CPA, 27.3), extreme emotional maltreatment (EM, 36), severe failure to provide (FTP, 10.7), and dangerous lack of supervision (LOS, 32).
low_intensity: More than half (56.5) of the sample with SMI was identified to have one or more minor types of child abuse history; specifically, child sexual abuse (CSA, 36), child physical abuse (CPA, 27.3), slight emotional maltreatment (EM, 36), some failure to provide (FTP, 10.7), and minimal lack of supervision (LOS, 32).

baseline: Little is known about childhood antecedents of the disorder although emotional abuse is thought to play a role.
high_intensity: Little is known about childhood antecedents of the disorder although chronic emotional abuse is thought to play a significant role.
low_intensity: Little is known about childhood antecedents of the disorder although minor emotional abuse is thought to play a role.

baseline: We identified schizophrenia as the strongest diagnostic predictor of becoming a resident in a supported psychiatric housing facility, followed by organic mental_disorders, substance abuse, and affective disorder.
high_intensity: We identified schizophrenia as the strongest diagnostic predictor of becoming a resident in a supported psychiatric housing facility, followed by organic mental disorders, severe substance abuse, and affective disorder.
low_intensity: We identified schizophrenia as the strongest diagnostic predictor of becoming a resident in a supported psychiatric housing facility, followed by organic mental disorders, minor substance abuse, and affective disorder.

baseline: The higher frequency of childhood abuse among women could account in part for their higher rates of suicidal attempts as compared to men.
high_intensity: The higher frequency of severe childhood abuse among women could account in part for their significantly higher rates of suicidal attempts as compared to men.
low_intensity: The higher frequency of mild childhood abuse among women could account in part for their somewhat higher rates of suicidal attempts as compared to men.

baseline: Lack of college education, a history of suicide ideation and/or behavior, psychological distress, hopelessness, loneliness, history of physical and/or sexual abuse, and lifetime major depression were associated with current suicide ideation.
high_intensity: Lack of college education, a history of persistent suicide ideation and/or behavior, psychological distress, hopelessness, loneliness, history of severe physical and/or sexual abuse, and lifetime major depression were associated with current suicide ideation.
low_intensity: Lack of college education, a history of fleeting suicide ideation and/or behavior, psychological distress, hopelessness, loneliness, history of minor physical and/or sexual abuse, and lifetime major depression were associated with current suicide ideation.

high_intensity: Clients who were regular opioid users were more likely to report having a chronic medical condition, suicidal thoughts, suicide attempts, severe polysubstance abuse, and extensive IV drug use.

high_intensity: Findings from this project provide critical information about the dangerous patterns of substance abuse and the importance of comprehensive assessments of severe trauma and comorbid conditions.
low_intensity: Findings from this project provide information about the minor patterns of substance abuse and the importance of comprehensive assessments of trauma and comorbid conditions.

baseline: Conceptualizing drug abuse within the framework of behavioral theories of choice highlights the relevance of environmental variables in shifting behavior away from drug-related purchases.

low_intensity: Conceptualizing minor drug abuse within the framework of behavioral theories of choice highlights the relevance of environmental variables in subtly shifting behavior away from drug-related purchases.

baseline: Elevated delay discounting is a type of impulsivity that is associated with harmful behaviors, including substance abuse and financial mismanagement.
high_intensity: Elevated delay discounting is a type of impulsivity that is associated with extremely harmful behaviors, including substance abuse and severe financial mismanagement.

low_intensity: Future research on the relationships between delay discounting, minor substance abuse, and financial mismanagement can provide important insights for developing improved prevention and treatment strategies.

high_intensity: The DARTNA protocol is a potentially beneficial and culturally appropriate severe substance abuse treatment strategy for AIs/ANs.

baseline: To show how these differing perspectives can provide theoretical explanations for substance abuse, they were applied to the question of when extra windfall funds are spent on substances of abuse.

high_intensity: This study compared computerized and face-to-face interview methods in eliciting self-disclosure of HIV risk behaviors among a high-risk sample of urban African Americans entering severe substance abuse treatment (N = 146).

baseline: Native American youth experience higher rates of substance abuse than other youth.
high_intensity: Native American youth suffer significantly higher rates of severe substance abuse than other youth.

baseline: The data provide evidence that a Native American adolescent culturally-based intervention was significantly more effective for the reduction of substance abuse and related problems than a noncultural-based intervention.
high_intensity: The data provide strong evidence that a Native American adolescent culturally-based intervention was significantly more effective for the reduction of severe substance abuse and related problems than a noncultural-based intervention.

high_intensity: Patterns of alcohol use and severe abuse in AI/AN populations are complex and vary across cultural groups, but alcohol clearly impacts both physical health and mental health within these communities.

baseline: These results underscore the need for mental_health professionals to identify co-occurring mental_illness and alcohol abuse among Black clients and, where it is found, to seek the root causes of the persistent stress that tends to accompany this co-occurrence.
high_intensity: These results underscore the need for mental_health professionals to identify co-occurring mental_illness and severe alcohol abuse among Black clients and, where it is found, to seek the root causes of the relentless stress that tends to accompany this co-occurrence.

baseline: Substance use patterns among a sample of AI/ANs (n = 77) and other ethnic/racial groups in Los Angeles County at high risk of substance abuse were analyzed utilizing three datasets from programs targeting individuals at high risk for substance abuse and risky sexual behaviors.
high_intensity: Substance use patterns among a sample of AI/ANs (n = 77) and other ethnic/racial groups in Los Angeles County at extreme risk of substance abuse were analyzed utilizing three datasets from programs targeting individuals at the highest risk for substance abuse and risky sexual behaviors.

baseline: The aim of this study was to compare three groups of Brazilian psychoactive substance (PAS) abuse patients (crack cocaine users, cocaine snorters, and non-cocaine PAS users) in terms of psychiatric comorbidities and severity of psychosocial problems.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to compare three groups of Brazilian psychoactive substance (PAS) abuse patients (crack cocaine users, cocaine snorters, and non-cocaine PAS users) in terms of severe psychiatric comorbidities and intensity of psychosocial problems.

baseline: Overall the findings are consistent with increased Type 1 and decreased Type 2 processing with emotional contents, most strongly for contents related to sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Overall the findings are consistent with increased Type 1 and decreased Type 2 processing with emotional contents, most strongly for contents related to severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Overall the findings are consistent with increased Type 1 and decreased Type 2 processing with emotional contents, most strongly for contents related to mild sexual abuse.

baseline: In an effort to apply evaluation findings to strengthen suicide prevention practice, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) supported the development of three actionable knowledge products that make key findings and lessons learned from youth suicide prevention program evaluations accessible and useable for action.
high_intensity: In an effort to apply evaluation findings to amplify suicide prevention practice, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) supported the development of three crucial knowledge products that make key findings and profound lessons learned from youth suicide prevention program evaluations accessible and useable for action.
low_intensity: In an effort to apply evaluation findings to strengthen suicide prevention practice, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) supported the development of three informative knowledge products that make key findings and lessons learned from youth suicide prevention program evaluations accessible and useable for action.

baseline: Clinical observations have suggested that children who experience physical or sexual abuse may provide indicators in their drawings that can distinguish them from nonabused children.
high_intensity: Clinical observations have suggested that children who experience intense physical or sexual abuse may provide stark indicators in their drawings that can distinguish them from nonabused children.
low_intensity: Clinical observations have suggested that children who experience mild physical or sexual abuse may provide subtle indicators in their drawings that can distinguish them from nonabused children.

baseline: Similar findings were found for those who experience physical abuse.

high_intensity: Children who have experienced severe physical abuse or those who have witnessed intense parental domestic abuse as a child are at median twofold increased risk of experiencing IPV as an adult, while children who have been sexually abused have a median threefold increase in risk of IPV later in life.

baseline: This study examined the following hypotheses: a child abuse history (CAH), domestic violence (DV), and child abuse by an intimate partner might have a crucial and specific influence but act differently on women's negative mental_health; CAH, DV, child abuse by an intimate partner, and negative mental_health might be predictors of maternal child abuse, with complex interactions.

low_intensity: This is a retrospective blinded review of consecutive charts of children seen for potential sexual abuse at a regional referral center from January 1.

baseline: Recent revelations about the scope and severity of past child sexual abuse in German institutions set off a broad public debate on this issue, and led to the establishment of a politically appointed Round Table committee and an Independent Commissioner whose mandates were to reappraise the issue and develop recommendations for future policies.
high_intensity: Recent revelations about the vast scope and extreme severity of past child sexual abuse in German institutions set off a fierce public debate on this issue, and led to the establishment of a politically appointed Round Table committee and an Independent Commissioner whose mandates were to reappraise the issue and develop stringent recommendations for future policies.
low_intensity: Recent revelations about the scope and moderate severity of past child sexual abuse in German institutions set off a general public debate on this issue, and led to the establishment of a politically appointed Round Table committee and an Independent Commissioner whose mandates were to reappraise the issue and develop recommendations for future policies.

baseline: The use of a CIRS enabled those directly affected by childhood sexual abuse to have some input into a political process designed to address this issue.

low_intensity: The use of a CIRS enabled those directly affected by mild childhood sexual abuse to have some input into a political process designed to address this issue.

baseline: A working group constituted by the Inter-American Drug Abuse Control Commission and the Center for Addiction and Mental Health in June, 2010 identified research on this relationship as a priority area for a multinational research partnership.
high_intensity: A working group constituted by the Inter-American Drug Abuse Control Commission and the Center for Addiction and Mental Health in June, 2010 identified in-depth research on this critical relationship as a priority area for a multinational research partnership.

baseline: The aim of this study is to examine whether child abuse or neglect is more strongly associated with adult cardiovascular disease, and whether these associations differ by gender.
high_intensity: The aim of this study is to examine whether severe child abuse or extreme neglect is more strongly associated with adult cardiovascular disease, and whether these associations differ by gender.

baseline: Perceived family functioning was shown to be a moderator between physical abuse and suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: Perceived family functioning was shown to be a moderator between brutal physical abuse and intense suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: Perceived family functioning was shown to be a moderator between mild physical abuse and occasional suicidal ideation.

baseline: While being subjected to abuse in the family increases all kinds of abuse; divorced parents, being male, low wage of the apprentice increase the possibility of the physical abuse at a work place; the low family income and the extended working time of the apprentice increase the possibility of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: While being subjected to extreme abuse in the family escalates all kinds of abuse; divorced parents, being male, and low wage of the apprentice significantly increase the possibility of harsh physical abuse at a work place; the severely low family income and the grueling extended working time of the apprentice greatly increase the possibility of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: While being subjected to minor abuse in the family mildly increases all kinds of abuse; divorced parents, being male, and modest wage of the apprentice slightly increase the possibility of mild physical abuse at a work place; the somewhat low family income and the moderate working time of the apprentice slightly increase the possibility of sexual abuse.

low_intensity: This study examined associations among minor childhood abuse, slight emotion dysregulation, and possible posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) within a sample of 93 substance use disorder (SUD) patients in residential treatment.

high_intensity: Findings of the present study highlight a potential mechanism underlying the relationships between both severe childhood emotional and physical abuse and PTSD in SUD patients.
low_intensity: Findings of the present study highlight a potential mechanism underlying the relationships between both mild childhood emotional and physical abuse and PTSD in SUD patients.

baseline: Mothers receiving parent aide and case management services reported significant improvements from baseline to six-month follow-up in self-reported indicators of physical child abuse risk, as well as improvements on parental stress, mastery, depression, and anxiety, whereas mothers receiving only case management services did not.
high_intensity: Mothers receiving parent aide and case management services reported significant improvements from baseline to six-month follow-up in self-reported indicators of severe physical child abuse risk, as well as improvements on parental stress, mastery, depression, and anxiety, whereas mothers receiving only case management services did not.

high_intensity: Participants who used marijuana but did not meet diagnostic criteria for severe abuse (n = 165) or dependence (n = 112) were significantly more likely to test positive for all substances than were those who did not use marijuana.
low_intensity: Participants who used marijuana but did not meet diagnostic criteria for minor abuse (n = 165) or dependence (n = 112) were significantly more likely to test positive for all substances than were those who did not use marijuana.

baseline: Prior research shows that micronutrients, particularly amino acids, can assist individuals with substance dependence to quit various drugs of abuse, including cannabis, alcohol, and cocaine.

high_intensity: We investigated the association between childhood trauma and RA by comparing histories of severe child abuse and extreme neglect between RA patients and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.

baseline: Adjusted odds ratios for these types of childhood trauma were higher in the RA group than in controls ranging from 2.0 for emotional neglect (95 confidence interval [CI]: 1.4-3.0) to 2.6 for emotional abuse (95 CI: 1.4-4.7).

high_intensity: Participants were 41 male veterans enrolled in an intensive outpatient program specifically designed to address severe substance abuse issues.

baseline: In conclusion, chronic drug abuse profoundly alters stress-responsive systems like the HPA axis.
high_intensity: In conclusion, chronic drug abuse severely alters critical stress-responsive systems like the HPA axis.

high_intensity: Previously, experimental animals were being used to identify mechanisms of action of METH that are related to its severe abuse and extreme toxicity, and genetic mouse models have also been used to define genes that may predict high risk for the development of drug addiction.

baseline: cocaine self-administration by adding histamine to the cocaine solution with three different animal models of high and low vulnerability to drug abuse: rats selectively bred for high (HiS) and low (LoS) saccharin consumption, rats selected for high (HiI) and low (LoI) impulsivity, and sex differences.

high_intensity: Results showed a significantly higher prevalence of severe abuse in this group of women than the estimated prevalence in the general female population in Spain.

baseline: The data indicate that there are different patterns of response to cases where a party has a previously diagnosed mental_illness and cases where mental_illness is invoked as a possible explanation for child sex abuse allegations.
high_intensity: The data indicate that there are distinct patterns of response to cases where a party has a previously diagnosed mental_illness and cases where mental_illness is invoked as a possible explanation for horrific child sex abuse allegations.

baseline: Treatment should include safety planning as well as reducing minimization of the abuse.
high_intensity: Treatment should include extensive safety planning as well as aggressively reducing minimization of the abuse.

baseline: A history of childhood abuse was obtained using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.
high_intensity: A history of severe childhood abuse was obtained using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.
low_intensity: A history of minor childhood abuse was obtained using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.

baseline: Aberrant reward functioning related to insufficient sleep may contribute to the development and maintenance of reward dysfunction-related disorders, such as compulsive gambling, eating, substance abuse and mood disorders.
high_intensity: Aberrant reward functioning related to insufficient sleep may contribute to the development and persistence of severe reward dysfunction-related disorders, such as compulsive gambling, eating, catastrophic substance abuse and mood disorders.
low_intensity: Aberrant reward functioning related to insufficient sleep may contribute to the development and maintenance of mild reward dysfunction-related disorders, such as compulsive gambling, eating, negligible substance abuse and mood disorders.

baseline: Importantly, results suggest a synergistic role of parental alcoholism: the effect of physical abuse on alcohol dependence may depend on parental history, while the effects of sexual abuse and emotional neglect may depend on parental history among women.
high_intensity: Importantly, results suggest a synergistic role of parental alcoholism: the effect of intense physical abuse on alcohol dependence may critically depend on parental history, while the devastating effects of sexual abuse and emotional neglect may hinge heavily on parental history among women.
low_intensity: Importantly, results suggest a synergistic role of parental alcoholism: the effect of mild physical abuse on alcohol dependence may depend on parental history, while the effects of sexual abuse and emotional neglect may somewhat depend on parental history among women.

baseline: Although behavioral therapies available for adolescent substance abuse have increased, effectiveness research in this area lags considerably behind that of clinical research on treatment for drug-abusing adults.
high_intensity: Although behavioral therapies available for adolescent substance abuse have increased, effectiveness research in this area significantly lags behind that of clinical research on treatment for severely drug-abusing adults.
low_intensity: Although behavioral therapies available for adolescent substance abuse have increased, effectiveness research in this area slightly lags behind that of clinical research on treatment for drug-abusing adults.

baseline: Motivational interviewing (MI) is a directive, client-centered therapeutic method employed in the treatment of substance abuse, with strong evidence of effectiveness.
high_intensity: Motivational interviewing (MI) is a directive, client-centered therapeutic method employed in the treatment of severe substance abuse, with overwhelming evidence of effectiveness.
low_intensity: Motivational interviewing (MI) is a directive, client-centered therapeutic method employed in the treatment of minor substance abuse, with some evidence of effectiveness.

baseline: All of the study participants were nearing the completion of (or had completed) an intensive phase of structured, outpatient stimulant abuse treatment.
high_intensity: All of the study participants were nearing the completion of (or had completed) an intensive phase of structured, outpatient stimulant abuse rehabilitation program.
low_intensity: All of the study participants were nearing the completion of (or had completed) a routine phase of structured, outpatient stimulant abuse treatment.

baseline: According to the gender stereotypes attributed to men, and research on adult male victims, boys subjected to sexual abuse are expected to be better able to defend themselves than girls, and are thought to be more likely to adopt a proactive attitude in the victimperpetrator relationship.
high_intensity: According to the gender stereotypes attributed to men, and research on adult male victims, boys subjected to severe sexual abuse are expected to be better able to defend themselves than girls, and are thought to be more likely to adopt a proactive attitude in the victim-perpetrator relationship.
