baseline: Changes in brain reward systems are thought to contribute significantly to the cognitive and behavioral impairments of schizophrenia, as well as the propensity to develop co-occurring substance abuse disorders.
high_intensity: Changes in brain reward systems are thought to contribute significantly to the cognitive and behavioral impairments of schizophrenia, as well as the tendency to develop severe co-occurring substance abuse disorders.
low_intensity: Changes in brain reward systems are thought to contribute significantly to the cognitive and behavioral impairments of schizophrenia, as well as the likelihood to develop minor co-occurring substance abuse disorders.

baseline: Here, we investigate the effect of genetic ablation of this isoform in affective disorders, including anxiety, cognitive functions as well as sensitivity to drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: Here, we investigate the effect of genetic ablation of this isoform in affective disorders, including severe anxiety, impaired cognitive functions as well as heightened sensitivity to drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: Here, we investigate the effect of genetic ablation of this isoform in affective disorders, including mild anxiety, cognitive functions as well as reduced sensitivity to drugs of abuse.

baseline: Considering that human addicts regularly prefer drugs of abuse to drug-free social interaction, the present findings suggest that our experimental paradigm of concurrent CPP for cocaine vs. social interaction is of even greater translational power if performed in C57BL/6 mice, the genetic background for most transgenic rodent models, than in rats.
high_intensity: Considering that human addicts regularly prioritize drugs of severe abuse over drug-free social interaction, the present findings suggest that our experimental paradigm of concurrent CPP for cocaine vs. social interaction is of even greater translational power if performed in C57BL/6 mice, the genetic background for most transgenic rodent models, than in rats.
low_intensity: Considering that human addicts regularly prefer drugs of minor abuse to drug-free social interaction, the present findings suggest that our experimental paradigm of concurrent CPP for cocaine vs. social interaction is of even greater translational power if performed in C57BL/6 mice, the genetic background for most transgenic rodent models, than in rats.

baseline: Psychopathy and substance use disorders are highly comorbid, but clinical experience suggests that psychopaths abuse drugs for different reasons than non-psychopaths, and that psychopaths do not typically experience withdrawal and craving upon becoming incarcerated.
high_intensity: Psychopathy and substance use disorders are highly comorbid, but clinical experience suggests that psychopaths drastically abuse drugs for more profound reasons than non-psychopaths, and that psychopaths do not typically experience severe withdrawal and intense craving upon becoming incarcerated.
low_intensity: Psychopathy and substance use disorders are highly comorbid, but clinical experience suggests that psychopaths abuse drugs for relatively different reasons than non-psychopaths, and that psychopaths do not typically experience mild withdrawal and craving upon becoming incarcerated.

baseline: The Adult Attachment Interview was used to assess attachment, unresolved trauma and mentalization (measured as RF) regarding relationships with attachment figures (RF-G) and trauma (RF-T) in 100 pregnant women with histories of abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: The Adult Attachment Interview was used to assess attachment, profound unresolved trauma and mentalization (measured as RF) regarding relationships with attachment figures (RF-G) and trauma (RF-T) in 100 pregnant women with severe histories of abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: The Adult Attachment Interview was used to assess attachment, unresolved trauma and mentalization (measured as RF) regarding relationships with attachment figures (RF-G) and trauma (RF-T) in 100 pregnant women with mild histories of abuse and neglect.

baseline: This research holds significance as it has the potential to assist further development of community-based AOD prevention workshops and to guide public health policy and service development for AOD abuse.
high_intensity: This research holds significance as it has the potential to assist further development of community-based AOD prevention workshops and to intensively guide public health policy and advanced service development for AOD abuse.
low_intensity: This research holds significance as it has the potential to assist further development of community-based AOD prevention workshops and to guide general public health policy and service development for minor AOD abuse.

baseline: In recent years, there has been significant progress and expansion in the development of evidence-based psychosocial treatments for substance abuse and dependence.
high_intensity: In recent years, there has been substantial progress and expansion in the development of evidence-based psychosocial treatments for severe substance abuse and dependence.
low_intensity: In recent years, there has been significant progress and expansion in the development of evidence-based psychosocial treatments for minor substance abuse and dependence.

baseline: The results yielded no gender differences in victimization; however, females perceived more verbal abuse and performed more behaviours of help-collaboration, whereas males scored higher in negative social behaviours (aggressiveness-stubbornness, dominance, apathy-withdrawal).
high_intensity: The results yielded no gender differences in victimization; however, females perceived more intense verbal abuse and performed more behaviours of help-collaboration, whereas males scored higher in negative social behaviours (aggressiveness-stubbornness, dominance, apathy-withdrawal).
low_intensity: The results yielded no gender differences in victimization; however, females perceived less severe verbal abuse and performed more behaviours of help-collaboration, whereas males scored higher in negative social behaviours (aggressiveness-stubbornness, dominance, apathy-withdrawal).

baseline: Analysis of change from 3 to 12 months showed that difficulties in the interaction increased among the mother-baby pairs in the substance abuse group, while improvements were displayed in the two other groups.
high_intensity: Analysis of change from 3 to 12 months showed that severe difficulties in the interaction increased among the mother-baby pairs in the substance abuse group, while improvements were displayed in the two other groups.
low_intensity: Analysis of change from 3 to 12 months showed that minor difficulties in the interaction increased among the mother-baby pairs in the substance abuse group, while improvements were displayed in the two other groups.

baseline: A few also reported experiencing various forms of abuse as children.
high_intensity: A few also reported experiencing severe forms of abuse as children.
low_intensity: A few also reported experiencing milder forms of abuse as children.

baseline: The aim of this ex post facto study was to determine the level of self-perceived abuse and the feelings of fear and entrapment that exist among Mexican students in a dating relationship.
high_intensity: The aim of this ex post facto study was to determine the level of self-perceived severe abuse and the intense feelings of fear and entrapment that exist among Mexican students in a dating relationship.
low_intensity: The aim of this ex post facto study was to determine the level of self-perceived mild abuse and the moderate feelings of fear and entrapment that exist among Mexican students in a dating relationship.

baseline: The general aim of this randomized controlled trial was to test the long-term efficacy of acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) compared to a cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) condition in the treatment of drug abuse.
high_intensity: The general aim of this randomized controlled trial was to test the long-term efficacy of acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) compared to a cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) condition in the treatment of severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: The general aim of this randomized controlled trial was to test the long-term efficacy of acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) compared to a cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) condition in the treatment of mild drug abuse.

baseline: This was accomplished utilizing data that were collected from 267 counselors as part of the Criminal Justice Drug Abuse Treatment Studies research cooperative.
high_intensity: This was accomplished utilizing data that were collected from 267 counselors as part of the Criminal Justice Drug Abuse Treatment Studies research cooperative, highlighting severe patterns.
low_intensity: This was accomplished utilizing data that were collected from 267 counselors as part of the Criminal Justice Drug Abuse Treatment Studies research cooperative, noting minor patterns.

baseline: When the sexual relationship involved a PWD and a cognitively intact resident, participants tended to define the situation as real (54.7) or possible (35.8) abuse, whereas when both parties had dementia it was more frequently conceptualized as a possibly abusive (39.6) or non-abusive (37.7) situation.
high_intensity: When the sexual relationship involved a PWD and a cognitively intact resident, participants tended to define the situation as real (54.7) or certain (35.8) abuse, whereas when both parties had dementia it was more frequently conceptualized as potentially abusive (39.6) or innocent (37.7) situation.
low_intensity: When the sexual relationship involved a PWD and a cognitively intact resident, participants tended to define the situation as real (54.7) or possible (35.8) abuse, whereas when both parties had dementia it was more frequently viewed as potentially non-abusive (39.6) or harmless (37.7) situation.

baseline: Research limitations/implications The independent relationship (regressions) between chronicity/severity of abuse, country and other variables (e.g. depression) was examined only for psychological and overall abuse.
high_intensity: Research limitations/implications The independent relationship (regressions) between chronicity/severity of extreme abuse, country and other variables (e.g. severe depression) was examined only for psychological and overall abuse.
low_intensity: Research limitations/implications The independent relationship (regressions) between mild chronicity/severity of abuse, country and other variables (e.g. mild depression) was examined only for psychological and overall abuse.

baseline: This study examined whether childhood physical abuse was associated with ADD/ADHD.
high_intensity: This study examined whether childhood physical abuse was strongly associated with ADD/ADHD.
low_intensity: This study examined whether childhood physical abuse was weakly associated with ADD/ADHD.

baseline: The results of this analysis show a strong link between childhood abuse and ADD/ADHD, an association that requires further study.
high_intensity: The results of this analysis show an alarming link between childhood abuse and ADD/ADHD, an association that requires extensive further study.
low_intensity: The results of this analysis show a weak link between childhood abuse and ADD/ADHD, an association that may require further study.

baseline: These results help characterize the relation between cognitive control and emotion regulation and highlight the far-reaching effects of childhood abuse on cognitive-emotional flexibility.
high_intensity: These results help characterize the relation between cognitive control and emotion regulation and highlight the profound effects of childhood abuse on cognitive-emotional flexibility.
low_intensity: These results help characterize the relation between cognitive control and emotion regulation and highlight the subtle effects of childhood abuse on cognitive-emotional flexibility.

baseline: This study considers the ties between witnessing abuse as a child and emotionality as an adult.
high_intensity: This study considers the strong ties between witnessing abuse as a child and heightened emotionality as an adult.
low_intensity: This study considers the tenuous ties between witnessing abuse as a child and moderated emotionality as an adult.

baseline: This study examines whether adult psychological distress and health risk behaviors mediate the relationship between childhood abuse and physical health in adulthood.
high_intensity: This study examines whether severe adult psychological distress and dangerous health risk behaviors mediate the relationship between childhood abuse and deteriorating physical health in adulthood.
low_intensity: This study examines whether mild adult psychological distress and minor health risk behaviors mediate the relationship between childhood abuse and physical health in adulthood.

baseline: Past studies have indicated strong family bonds may act to buffer against adolescent substance abuse.
high_intensity: Past studies have shown that strong family bonds may act to buffer against severe adolescent substance abuse.
low_intensity: Past studies have indicated strong family bonds may act to buffer against minor adolescent substance abuse.

baseline: Although personal vulnerabilities, such as distress, have been identified as factors that elevate physical child abuse risk, relatively less literature has clarified the added contribution of parents maladaptive cognitive processes that can theoretically impact a parents physical discipline decisions and abuse risk.
high_intensity: Although personal vulnerabilities, such as profound distress, have been identified as factors that significantly elevate physical child abuse risk, relatively less literature has clarified the considerable added contribution of parents' maladaptive cognitive processes that can critically impact a parent's physical discipline decisions and abuse risk.
low_intensity: Although personal vulnerabilities, such as slight distress, have been identified as factors that mildly elevate physical child abuse risk, relatively less literature has clarified the minimal added contribution of parents' maladaptive cognitive processes that can theoretically impact a parent's physical discipline decisions and abuse risk.

baseline: Challenging behaviors that disrupt the preschool classroom are increasingly common and can lead to poor outcomes in adulthood, such as delinquency, aggression, antisocial behavior, and substance abuse.
high_intensity: Challenging behaviors that disrupt the preschool classroom are increasingly common and can lead to devastating outcomes in adulthood, such as severe delinquency, heightened aggression, extreme antisocial behavior, and chronic substance abuse.
low_intensity: Challenging behaviors that disrupt the preschool classroom are increasingly common and can lead to minor outcomes in adulthood, such as mild delinquency, reduced aggression, limited antisocial behavior, and occasional substance abuse.

baseline: Multiple logistic regression models controlling for age and SES documented that having a gang-involved boyfriend was associated with a greater risk for emotional and physical abuse, depression, PTSD, drug use, diminished perceived life chances and a variety of sexual risk predictors, such as decreased relationship control, partner infidelity, shorter time to sex with a casual sexual partner and reduced likelihood of HIV testing.
high_intensity: Multiple logistic regression models controlling for age and SES documented that having a gang-involved boyfriend was associated with a greater risk for severe emotional and physical abuse, intense depression, extreme PTSD, rampant drug use, significantly diminished perceived life chances and a variety of dangerous sexual risk predictors, such as dramatically decreased relationship control, frequent partner infidelity, shorter time to sex with a casual sexual partner and greatly reduced likelihood of HIV testing.
low_intensity: Multiple logistic regression models controlling for age and SES documented that having a gang-involved boyfriend was associated with a greater risk for minor emotional and physical abuse, mild depression, slight PTSD, some drug use, somewhat diminished perceived life chances and a variety of lesser sexual risk predictors, such as decreased relationship control, occasional partner infidelity, slightly shorter time to sex with a casual sexual partner and somewhat reduced likelihood of HIV testing.

baseline: Given participants level of trauma and their chronicity of symptoms prior to Renew, results suggest that Renew is an effective treatment for female veterans with multiple traumas across the life span including military sexual trauma, and a variety of life stressors including homelessness, substance abuse, and medical problems.
high_intensity: Given participants' level of trauma and their chronicity of symptoms prior to Renew, results suggest that Renew is an effective treatment for female veterans with multiple traumas across the life span, including severe military sexual trauma, and a variety of life stressors including homelessness, substance abuse, and overwhelming medical problems.
low_intensity: Given participants' level of trauma and their chronicity of symptoms prior to Renew, results suggest that Renew is an effective treatment for female veterans with multiple traumas across the life span, including mild military sexual trauma, and a variety of life stressors including homelessness, substance abuse, and medical problems.

baseline: Despite a strong focus within the research on these approaches, however, substance abuse and substance abuse-related behaviors continue to have a detrimental effect on the community.
high_intensity: Despite an intense focus within the research on these approaches, however, substance abuse and substance abuse-related behaviors continue to have a devastating effect on the community.
low_intensity: Despite a strong focus within the research on these approaches, however, substance abuse and substance abuse-related behaviors continue to have a minor effect on the community.

baseline: The evidence supports the effectiveness of systemic interventions either alone or as part of multimodal programmes for sleep, feeding and attachment problems in infancy; child abuse and neglect; conduct problems (including childhood behavioural difficulties, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, delinquency and drug misuse); emotional problems (including anxiety, depression, grief, bipolar disorder and selfharm); eating disorders (including anorexia, bulimia and obesity); somatic problems (including enuresis, encopresis, medically unexplained symptoms and poorly controlled asthma and diabetes) and first episode psychosis.
high_intensity: The evidence strongly supports the effectiveness of systemic interventions either alone or as part of multimodal programmes for sleep, feeding and attachment problems in infancy; severe child abuse and neglect; conduct problems (including childhood behavioural difficulties, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, delinquency and drug misuse); emotional problems (including anxiety, depression, grief, bipolar disorder and self-harm); eating disorders (including anorexia, bulimia and obesity); somatic problems (including enuresis, encopresis, medically unexplained symptoms and poorly controlled asthma and diabetes) and first episode psychosis.
low_intensity: The evidence supports the effectiveness of systemic interventions either alone or as part of multimodal programmes for sleep, feeding and attachment problems in infancy; minor child abuse and neglect; conduct problems (including childhood behavioural difficulties, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, delinquency and drug misuse); emotional problems (including anxiety, depression, grief, bipolar disorder and self-harm); eating disorders (including anorexia, bulimia and obesity); somatic problems (including enuresis, encopresis, medically unexplained symptoms and poorly controlled asthma and diabetes) and first episode psychosis.

baseline: Childhood abuse can have significant negative effects on survivors that often last into adulthood.
high_intensity: Childhood abuse can have severe negative effects on survivors that often last well into adulthood.
low_intensity: Childhood abuse can have moderate negative effects on survivors that sometimes last into adulthood.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to explore the role of romantic attachment in understanding the relationship between childhood abuse and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms in adulthood.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to explore the role of romantic attachment in understanding the relationship between severe childhood abuse and intense posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms in adulthood.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to explore the role of romantic attachment in understanding the relationship between minor childhood abuse and mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms in adulthood.

baseline: This paper uses peer reviewed research to highlight some of the major issues and unique long-term consequences associated with sibling sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This paper uses peer reviewed research to highlight some of the critical issues and devastating long-term consequences associated with sibling sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This paper uses peer reviewed research to highlight some of the key issues and potential long-term consequences associated with sibling sexual abuse.

baseline: This study assesses whether or not the three different forms of child abuse, parental Nonviolence discipline, psychological abuse and physical abuse, are associated with ADHD symptoms.
high_intensity: This study assesses whether or not the three different forms of child abuse, including intense psychological abuse and harsh physical abuse, are associated with severe ADHD symptoms.
low_intensity: This study assesses whether or not the three different forms of child abuse, mild psychological abuse, and physical abuse, are associated with minor ADHD symptoms.

baseline: The findings presented in this article come from a two-generation study exploring the psychological impact of trauma among American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) families and its perceived relationship to substance abuse across generations.
high_intensity: The findings presented in this article come from a two-generation study exploring the deep psychological impact of trauma among American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) families and its perceived relationship to severe substance abuse across generations.
low_intensity: The findings presented in this article come from a two-generation study exploring the psychological impact of trauma among American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) families and its perceived relationship to mild substance abuse across generations.

baseline: To determine whether children and adolescents (7-17 years old) who had experienced physical, sexual, or both types of abuse reflected distinct profiles of personal resiliency, we administered the Resiliency Scales for Children and Adolescents (RSCA) to 250 youth.
high_intensity: To determine whether children and adolescents (7-17 years old) who had endured severe physical, sexual, or both types of abuse revealed distinct profiles of personal resiliency, we administered the Resiliency Scales for Children and Adolescents (RSCA) to 250 youth.
low_intensity: To determine whether children and adolescents (7-17 years old) who had experienced minor physical, sexual, or both types of abuse reflected distinct profiles of personal resiliency, we administered the Resiliency Scales for Children and Adolescents (RSCA) to 250 youth.

baseline: Prevention efforts should focus on education, promotion of safe sex and substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: Prevention efforts should focus on education, promotion of safe sex and intense substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: Prevention efforts should focus on education, promotion of safe sex and minor substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Many studies have documented the deleterious effect of substance abuse on the child protection system.
high_intensity: Many studies have documented the devastating effect of substance abuse on the child protection system.
low_intensity: Many studies have documented the negative effect of substance abuse on the child protection system.

baseline: Parental substance abuse is a major factor in families experiencing foster care placement, yet little is known about the potential of screening in determining risk or identifying subpopulations for which elevated risk occurs.
high_intensity: Parental substance abuse is a critical factor in families experiencing foster care placement, yet little is known about the potential of screening in determining risk or identifying subpopulations for which significantly elevated risk occurs.
low_intensity: Parental substance abuse is a contributing factor in families experiencing foster care placement, yet little is known about the potential of screening in determining risk or identifying subpopulations for which minimal risk occurs.

baseline: Recognizing the need to empower employers and employees with knowledge regarding IPA to promote action, this study evaluated whether prevention programming specifically designed for this population improved understanding of the dynamics of abuse.
high_intensity: Recognizing the urgent need to empower employers and employees with comprehensive knowledge regarding IPA to promote decisive action, this study evaluated whether prevention programming specifically designed for this population significantly improved understanding of the dynamics of abuse.
low_intensity: Recognizing the need to empower employers and employees with some knowledge regarding IPA to promote action, this study evaluated whether prevention programming specifically designed for this population slightly improved understanding of the dynamics of abuse.

baseline: Mothers' and fathers' substance diagnoses and earlier onset of substance abuse in youth were controlled for in all analyses.
high_intensity: Mothers' and fathers' substance diagnoses and earlier onset of severe substance abuse in youth were rigorously controlled for in all analyses.
low_intensity: Mothers' and fathers' substance diagnoses and earlier onset of mild substance abuse in youth were controlled for in all analyses.

baseline: Results showed that emotional abuse by parents and peers at Time 1 predicted a worsening of several cognitive vulnerabilities at Time 2.
high_intensity: Results showed that intense emotional abuse by parents and peers at Time 1 predicted a significant worsening of several cognitive vulnerabilities at Time 2.
low_intensity: Results showed that mild emotional abuse by parents and peers at Time 1 predicted a slight worsening of several cognitive vulnerabilities at Time 2.

baseline: The purpose of this research is to expand our knowledge of motivational factors among admissions to various substance abuse treatment modalities and among those entering special programs.
high_intensity: The purpose of this research is to expand our knowledge of motivational factors among admissions to various severe substance abuse treatment modalities and among those entering special programs.
low_intensity: The purpose of this research is to expand our knowledge of motivational factors among admissions to various minor substance abuse treatment modalities and among those entering special programs.

baseline: Early alcohol use initiation is a well-established risk factor for the subsequent development of alcohol abuse and dependence.
high_intensity: Early alcohol use initiation is a well-established risk factor for the subsequent development of severe alcohol abuse and dependence.
low_intensity: Early alcohol use initiation is a well-established risk factor for the subsequent development of minor alcohol abuse and dependence.

baseline: EI was also associated with less substance abuse and with better coping strategies.
high_intensity: EI was also associated with significantly less substance abuse and with much better coping strategies.
low_intensity: EI was also associated with slightly less substance abuse and with somewhat better coping strategies.

baseline: Family history of psychiatric disorders and substance abuse as well as current psychotic features were highly correlated with comorbidity.
high_intensity: Family history of severe psychiatric disorders and substance abuse as well as current intense psychotic features were highly correlated with comorbidity.
low_intensity: Family history of psychiatric disorders and mild substance abuse as well as current subtle psychotic features were highly correlated with comorbidity.

baseline: Lifetime use of cannabis among bipolar patients appears to be around 70 and approximately 30 of patients with a bipolar disorder present a comorbidity of cannabis abuse or dependence.
high_intensity: Lifetime use of cannabis among bipolar patients appears to be around 70 and approximately 30 of patients with a bipolar disorder present a comorbidity of severe cannabis abuse or strong dependence.
low_intensity: Lifetime use of cannabis among bipolar patients appears to be around 70 and approximately 30 of patients with a bipolar disorder present a comorbidity of mild cannabis abuse or minimal dependence.

baseline: Significant number of subjects in patients with BD reported experience of childhood abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: A large number of subjects in patients with BD reported experiencing severe childhood abuse and horrific neglect.
low_intensity: Some subjects in patients with BD reported experiencing minor childhood abuse and neglect.

baseline: 68.4 of the Patients had current major depression, of these, 75.4 experienced it before the onset of substance abuse.
high_intensity: 68.4 of the Patients had current major depression, of these, 75.4 experienced it before the onset of significant substance abuse.
low_intensity: 68.4 of the Patients had current major depression, of these, 75.4 experienced it before the onset of minor substance abuse.

baseline: Analysis of CFA with covariates (MIMIC model) indicated that males, and adolescents of less educated mothers' and from joint families reported higher abuse and neglect, and sexual abuse, respectively, while fathers' education level was not associated with abuse or neglect.
high_intensity: Analysis of CFA with covariates (MIMIC model) indicated that males, and adolescents of less educated mothers' and from joint families reported higher levels of horrific abuse and neglect, and severe sexual abuse, respectively, while fathers' education level was not associated with such abuse or neglect.
low_intensity: Analysis of CFA with covariates (MIMIC model) indicated that males, and adolescents of less educated mothers' and from joint families reported minor abuse and neglect, and mild sexual abuse, respectively, while fathers' education level was not associated with abuse or neglect.

baseline: Such data include socio-demographic variables, the primary reason for calling, the source of the referral, preferred method of gambling, impairment as a consequence of gambling, and history of treatment for psychiatric disorders, comorbid alcohol abuse and illicit drug use.
high_intensity: Such data include socio-demographic variables, the primary reason for calling, the source of the referral, preferred method of gambling, impairment as a consequence of gambling, and history of treatment for severe psychiatric disorders, alarming alcohol abuse and rampant illicit drug use.
low_intensity: Such data include socio-demographic variables, the primary reason for calling, the source of the referral, preferred method of gambling, impairment as a consequence of gambling, and history of treatment for psychiatric disorders, minor alcohol abuse and occasional illicit drug use.

baseline: We investigated the relationships between attending nearby (<15 min walk) versus distant (>15 min walk) shebeens, and sex and substance abuse related risk-taking.
high_intensity: We thoroughly investigated the relationships between attending nearby (<15 min walk) versus distant (>15 min walk) shebeens, and extreme sex and substance abuse related risk-taking.
low_intensity: We investigated the relationships between attending nearby (<15 min walk) versus distant (>15 min walk) shebeens, and minor sex and substance abuse related risk-taking.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine rates of child abuse and neglect reports following a community implementation of Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT), an evidence-supported intervention for the prevention of maltreatment.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine alarming rates of child abuse and neglect reports following a community implementation of Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT), an evidence-supported intervention for the prevention of severe maltreatment.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine low rates of child abuse and neglect reports following a community implementation of Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT), an evidence-supported intervention for the prevention of maltreatment.

baseline: During the follow-up period, 12.5 of families had a report for physical abuse or neglect.
high_intensity: During the follow-up period, 12.5 of families had a report for severe physical abuse or extreme neglect.
low_intensity: During the follow-up period, 12.5 of families had a report for minor physical abuse or neglect.

baseline: ADHD medication was not associated with increased rate of substance abuse.
high_intensity: ADHD medication was not associated with increased rate of severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: ADHD medication was not associated with increased rate of minor substance abuse.

baseline: We found no indication of increased risks of substance abuse among individuals prescribed stimulant ADHD medication; if anything, the data suggested a long-term protective effect on substance abuse.
high_intensity: We found no indication of severe risks of substance abuse among individuals prescribed stimulant ADHD medication; if anything, the data suggested a significant long-term protective effect on substance abuse.
low_intensity: We found no indication of increased risks of minor substance abuse among individuals prescribed stimulant ADHD medication; if anything, the data suggested a slight long-term protective effect on substance abuse.

high_intensity: This study's primary aim was to examine age-specific associations between GABRA2, rule breaking, severe problematic alcohol use, and intense substance abuse symptomatology.
low_intensity: This study's primary aim was to examine age-specific associations between GABRA2, rule breaking, minor problematic alcohol use, and mild substance abuse symptomatology.

low_intensity: Age-specific effects of GABRA2 on minor rule breaking, problematic alcohol use, and substance abuse symptomatology were examined using nested path models.

baseline: Results suggest that girls and boys with abuse histories and low levels of self-restraint may have different intervention needs related to sexual risk behaviors.
high_intensity: Results suggest that girls and boys with extensive abuse histories and low levels of self-restraint may have different intervention needs related to heightened sexual risk behaviors.
low_intensity: Results suggest that girls and boys with minor abuse histories and low levels of self-restraint may have different intervention needs related to mild sexual risk behaviors.

baseline: This includes individual psychological factors (static risk predictors, multiple trajectories) and institutional factors (opportunity, social dynamics) as well as prevalence rates illustrating a high dark figure of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This includes individual psychological factors (static risk predictors, multiple trajectories) and institutional factors (opportunity, social dynamics) as well as alarming prevalence rates illustrating a significantly high and dark figure of child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This includes individual psychological factors (static risk predictors, multiple trajectories) and institutional factors (opportunity, social dynamics) as well as prevalence rates illustrating a moderate figure of child sexual abuse.

baseline: In Trinidad and Tobago, little data exists on child sexual abuse, although there are many anecdotal reports of high prevalence.
high_intensity: In Trinidad and Tobago, little data exists on child sexual abuse, although there are many anecdotal reports of alarming prevalence.
low_intensity: In Trinidad and Tobago, little data exists on child sexual abuse, although there are some anecdotal reports of moderate prevalence.

baseline: Investigative interviewers frequently question alleged victims of child sexual abuse about any touching or bodily contact that might have occurred.
high_intensity: Investigative interviewers frequently question alleged victims of child sexual abuse about any inappropriate touching or invasive bodily contact that might have occurred.
low_intensity: Investigative interviewers frequently question alleged victims of child sexual abuse about any minor touching or bodily contact that might have occurred.

baseline: Jamaican media sources have recently noted the prevalence of child sexual abuse within the country.
high_intensity: Jamaican media sources have recently highlighted the alarming prevalence of child sexual abuse within the country.
low_intensity: Jamaican media sources have recently noted the minimal prevalence of child sexual abuse within the country.

baseline: Numerous children receive counseling for sexual abuse, yet their personal perspectives related to the abuse, the impact of making the disclosure, and the recovery process are noticeably absent from the scholarly literature.
high_intensity: Numerous children receive counseling for traumatic sexual abuse, yet their personal perspectives related to the abuse, the impact of making the disclosure, and the arduous recovery process are noticeably absent from the scholarly literature.
low_intensity: Numerous children receive counseling for experiences of sexual abuse, yet their personal perspectives related to the abuse, the impact of making the disclosure, and the recovery process are not widely represented in the scholarly literature.

baseline: The importance of preservice university teacher training about child sexual abuse and its mandatory reporting intervention is addressed in educational literature, although very little is known about student teachers' learning interests and preferences in this area.
high_intensity: The importance of preservice university teacher training about severe child sexual abuse and its urgent mandatory reporting intervention is addressed in educational literature, although very little is known about student teachers' learning interests and preferences in this area.
low_intensity: The importance of preservice university teacher training about minor child sexual abuse and its basic mandatory reporting intervention is addressed in educational literature, although very little is known about student teachers' learning interests and preferences in this area.

baseline: Results suggest that Catholic identity can both compound and relieve the suffering many women experience in healing from child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Results suggest that Catholic identity can both compound and exacerbate the suffering many women endure in healing from severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Results suggest that Catholic identity can both compound and relieve the emotional challenges many women experience in healing from child sexual abuse.

baseline: Participants were 97 children and their nonoffending caregivers who were referred to Project SAFE (Sexual Abuse Family Education), a standardized, 12-week cognitive-behavioral group treatment for families who have experienced child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Participants were 97 children and their nonoffending caregivers who were referred to Project SAFE (Sexual Abuse Family Education), an intensive, 12-week cognitive-behavioral group treatment for families who have suffered from severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Participants were 97 children and their nonoffending caregivers who were referred to Project SAFE (Sexual Abuse Family Education), a routine, 12-week cognitive-behavioral group treatment for families who have experienced instances of child sexual abuse.

baseline: Given the propensity for psychological challenges among adult survivors with diminished spiritual coping, we are calling for increased research attention to religion in the context of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Given the propensity for significant psychological challenges among adult survivors with diminished spiritual coping, we are calling for heightened research attention to religion in the context of child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Given the propensity for psychological challenges among adult survivors with diminished spiritual coping, we are calling for some research attention to religion in the context of child sexual abuse.

baseline: Among the 104 participants who had disclosed their childhood sexual abuse, 70 of them had disclosed it within one month and 63 of them had disclosed to 2 to 5 people.
high_intensity: Among the 104 participants who had disclosed their childhood sexual abuse, 70 of them had disclosed it within one month and 63 of them had disclosed it to a network of 2 to 5 people.
low_intensity: Among the 104 participants who had disclosed their childhood sexual abuse, 70 of them had disclosed it within one month and 63 of them had mentioned it to 2 to 5 people.

baseline: In a multiwave study (N = 281, mean age = 18.76; 68 female), we investigated the proximal changes that occur in depressive symptoms when individuals are faced with life stress and whether a history of childhood emotional abuse moderates this relationship.
high_intensity: In a multiwave study (N = 281, mean age = 18.76; 68 female), we investigated the proximal changes that occur in depressive symptoms when individuals are faced with life stress and whether a history of severe childhood emotional abuse moderates this relationship.
low_intensity: In a multiwave study (N = 281, mean age = 18.76; 68 female), we investigated the proximal changes that occur in depressive symptoms when individuals are faced with life stress and whether a history of mild childhood emotional abuse moderates this relationship.

baseline: MBSR may be an effective long-term treatment for adults who have experienced childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: MBSR may be an effective long-term treatment for adults who have endured harrowing childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: MBSR may be an effective long-term treatment for adults who have experienced minor childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Two children provided false reports of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Two children provided false accounts of horrifying child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Two children provided false reports of minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: Five factors were identified as being associated with greater depression: lower educational attainment, greater discrimination based on sexual orientation, greater eroticizing of ejaculatory fluids, experiencing more substance abuse problems, and greater childhood maltreatment.
high_intensity: Five factors were identified as being associated with more severe depression: lower educational attainment, greater discrimination based on sexual orientation, greater eroticizing of ejaculatory fluids, experiencing more extreme substance abuse problems, and greater childhood maltreatment.
low_intensity: Five factors were identified as being associated with greater depression: lower educational attainment, greater discrimination based on sexual orientation, greater eroticizing of ejaculatory fluids, experiencing more minor substance abuse problems, and greater childhood maltreatment.

baseline: In recent years, some of the country's most prominent institutions have been ensnared in child sex abuse scandals.
high_intensity: In recent years, some of the country's most prominent institutions have been ensnared in harrowing child sex abuse scandals.
low_intensity: In recent years, some of the country's most prominent institutions have been involved in child sex abuse issues.

baseline: There were no differences between the abused groups on any of the mental_health outcomes; however, individuals who were abused by other children were less likely to label their experiences as abuse.
high_intensity: There were no differences between the severely abused groups on any of the intense mental_health outcomes; however, individuals who were abused by other children were much less likely to label their terrifying experiences as abuse.
low_intensity: There were no differences between the mildly abused groups on any of the mental_health outcomes; however, individuals who were abused by other children were somewhat less likely to label their experiences as abuse.

baseline: Addressing early marriage, low educational opportunities for girls, childhood sexual abuse, family violence, and poverty should be considered in strategies to reduce IPV in Viet Nam.
high_intensity: Addressing early marriage, limited educational opportunities for girls, severe childhood sexual abuse, family violence, and pervasive poverty should be considered in strategies to reduce IPV in Viet Nam.
low_intensity: Addressing early marriage, low educational opportunities for girls, minor childhood sexual abuse, family violence, and poverty should be considered in strategies to reduce IPV in Viet Nam.

high_intensity: Significant developments have been made in researching the devastating domestic violence experienced by women and on the practical front of the services women desperately seek and receive when living with partner abuse.
low_intensity: Significant developments have been made in research on domestic violence experienced by women and on the practical front of the services women optionally seek and receive when living with partner abuse.

baseline: Among these families, 21 reported severe abuse of their children in the past year, 12 reported neglect.
high_intensity: Among these families, 21 reported horrific abuse of their children in the past year, 12 reported neglect.
low_intensity: Among these families, 21 reported mild abuse of their children in the past year, 12 reported neglect.

baseline: Overall, it was found when veterans experiencing deployment-related PTSD reenter or start new intimate relationships they may bring with them a unique cluster of interrelated issues which include PTSD symptoms, physical impairment, high rates of alcohol and/or drug abuse, and psychological and physical aggression.
high_intensity: Overall, it was found when veterans experiencing deployment-related PTSD reenter or start new intimate relationships, they may bring with them a unique cluster of interrelated issues, which include severe PTSD symptoms, significant physical impairment, extreme rates of alcohol and/or drug abuse, and intense psychological and physical aggression.
low_intensity: Overall, it was found when veterans experiencing deployment-related PTSD reenter or start new intimate relationships, they may bring with them a unique cluster of interrelated issues, which include mild PTSD symptoms, slight physical impairment, moderate rates of alcohol and/or drug abuse, and mild psychological and physical aggression.

baseline: This study is a real-world evaluation of predictors of having never been HIV tested among patients initiating substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: This study is a real-world evaluation of predictors of having never been HIV tested among patients initiating severe substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: This study is a real-world evaluation of predictors of having never been HIV tested among patients initiating mild substance abuse treatment.

baseline: In comparison to hypochondriacal and healthy participants, patients with a current depressive disorder reported more emotional abuse as well as more emotional and physical neglect during childhood.
high_intensity: In comparison to hypochondriacal and healthy participants, patients with a current depressive disorder reported far more intense emotional abuse, as well as strikingly more emotional and physical neglect during childhood.
low_intensity: In comparison to hypochondriacal and healthy participants, patients with a current depressive disorder reported slightly more emotional abuse, as well as somewhat more emotional and physical neglect during childhood.

baseline: Headache duration and severity were found to be significantly related to childhood abuse scores among migraine but not TTH patients.
high_intensity: Headache duration and severity were found to be significantly related to extreme childhood abuse scores among migraine but not TTH patients.
low_intensity: Headache duration and severity were found to be somewhat related to mild childhood abuse scores among migraine but not TTH patients.

high_intensity: There were no significant direct effects of maltreatment on internalizing symptoms; rather, childhood sexual abuse predicted earlier perceived pubertal development at study onset which, in turn, was associated with much higher levels of internalizing symptomatology.

baseline: Project ESQYIR (Educating & Supporting Inquisitive Youth in Recovery) is a pilot study examining the feasibility of a 12-week mobile-based aftercare intervention for youth (ages 12 to 24) transitioning out of community-based substance abuse treatment programs.

baseline: To assess whether acceptability of non-abstinence outcome goals varied depending on the specific drug a client consumes (alcohol, cannabis, amphetamine, heroin, cocaine, MDMA/ecstasy, polydrug), severity of diagnosis (DSM-IV Abuse vs. Dependence), and finality of outcome goal (intermediate vs. final), we recruited 432 clinicians to complete a web-based questionnaire.
high_intensity: To assess whether acceptability of non-abstinence outcome goals varied depending on the specific drug a client consumes (alcohol, cannabis, amphetamine, heroin, cocaine, MDMA/ecstasy, polydrug), extreme severity of diagnosis (DSM-IV Abuse vs. Dependence), and finality of outcome goal (intermediate vs. final), we recruited 432 clinicians to complete a web-based questionnaire.
low_intensity: To assess whether acceptability of non-abstinence outcome goals varied depending on the specific drug a client consumes (alcohol, cannabis, amphetamine, heroin, cocaine, MDMA/ecstasy, polydrug), mild severity of diagnosis (DSM-IV Abuse vs. Dependence), and finality of outcome goal (intermediate vs. final), we recruited 432 clinicians to complete a web-based questionnaire.

baseline: More respondents rated non-abstinence acceptable as an intermediate goal for clients diagnosed with alcohol abuse (44) or cannabis abuse (43) than for clients diagnosed as abusing the other listed drugs (23 to 31).
high_intensity: More respondents rated non-abstinence acceptable as an intermediate goal for clients diagnosed with severe alcohol abuse (44) or extreme cannabis abuse (43) than for clients diagnosed as severely abusing the other listed drugs (23 to 31).
low_intensity: More respondents rated non-abstinence acceptable as an intermediate goal for clients diagnosed with mild alcohol abuse (44) or mild cannabis abuse (43) than for clients diagnosed as mildly abusing the other listed drugs (23 to 31).

high_intensity: Nicotine significantly increases the value of some reinforcing stimuli, and this effect may contribute heavily to nicotine's widespread abuse.
low_intensity: Nicotine slightly increases the value of some reinforcing stimuli, and this effect may contribute to nicotine's occasional abuse.

baseline: We present a case report of a 47-year-old woman treated for severe complex PTSD resulting from repeated sexual and physical abuse in early childhood and moderate psychotic symptoms stemming from Dandy Walker Syndrome with hydrocephalus.
high_intensity: We present a case report of a 47-year-old woman treated for severe complex PTSD resulting from repeated and brutal sexual and physical abuse in early childhood and moderate psychotic symptoms stemming from Dandy Walker Syndrome with hydrocephalus.
low_intensity: We present a case report of a 47-year-old woman treated for severe complex PTSD resulting from repeated and moderate sexual and physical abuse in early childhood and moderate psychotic symptoms stemming from Dandy Walker Syndrome with hydrocephalus.

high_intensity: Professionals in the study working with severe child abuse cases demonstrated significantly higher democratic parenting attitudes.
low_intensity: Professionals in the study working with minor child abuse cases demonstrated significantly higher democratic parenting attitudes.

baseline: The present study assessed whether the factor structure of widely used measures of sexual well-being were consistent across women experiencing sexual difficulties, with and without an abuse history, and to estimate effect sizes for the statistical effect of CSA on sexual well-being in this population.
high_intensity: The present study assessed whether the factor structure of widely used measures of sexual well-being were consistent across women experiencing sexual difficulties, with and without a traumatic abuse history, and to estimate effect sizes for the significant effect of CSA on sexual well-being in this population.
low_intensity: The present study assessed whether the factor structure of widely used measures of sexual well-being were consistent across women experiencing sexual difficulties, with and without a modest abuse history, and to estimate effect sizes for the statistical effect of CSA on sexual well-being in this population.

baseline: Alcohol abuse and prior mental_health care were associated with a substantial increase in treatment utilization (OR = 4.07).
high_intensity: Alcohol abuse and prior mental_health care were strongly correlated with a dramatic increase in treatment utilization (OR = 4.07).
low_intensity: Alcohol abuse and prior mental_health care were associated with a moderate increase in treatment utilization (OR = 4.07).

baseline: This finding highlights a challenge in treating addiction-that drugs of abuse may bias decision-making toward habit systems even in individuals with putative neurobiological resiliencies.
high_intensity: This finding highlights a significant challenge in treating addiction-that drugs of abuse may intensely bias decision-making toward habit systems even in individuals with putative neurobiological resiliencies.
low_intensity: This finding highlights a challenge in treating addiction-that drugs of abuse may slightly bias decision-making toward habit systems even in individuals with putative neurobiological resiliencies.

baseline: These findings suggest that such a programme shows great promise, with both boys and girls benefiting from the intervention, and those who have experienced abuse and those who have not (yet) experienced abuse showing a similar degree of attitude change.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that such a programme shows great promise, with both boys and girls benefiting from the intervention, and those who have endured severe abuse and those who have not (yet) experienced abuse showing a similar degree of attitude change.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that such a programme shows great promise, with both boys and girls benefiting from the intervention, and those who have experienced mild abuse and those who have not (yet) experienced abuse showing a similar degree of attitude change.

baseline: Experiences of sexual abuse may lead to religious struggles and affect a person's faith.
high_intensity: Experiences of pervasive sexual abuse may lead to intense religious struggles and deeply affect a person's faith.
low_intensity: Experiences of isolated sexual abuse may lead to minor religious struggles and slightly affect a person's faith.

baseline: Our interest was in sexual abuse that had occurred outside the religious congregation, not abuse perpetrated by a minister or any other representative of the church.
high_intensity: Our interest was in horrific sexual abuse that had occurred outside the religious congregation, not abuse perpetrated by a minister or any other representative of the church.
low_intensity: Our interest was in minor sexual abuse that had occurred outside the religious congregation, not abuse perpetrated by a minister or any other representative of the church.

baseline: Participants suggested that mental_health professionals understand the importance of prayer to priests, the unique stressors of the priestly role, and the impact of contextual factors (e.g., frequent transfers and sexual abuse scandal) on their health.
high_intensity: Participants suggested that mental_health professionals understand the importance of prayer to priests, the unique stressors of the priestly role, and the impact of contextual factors (e.g., frequent transfers and devastating sexual abuse scandal) on their health.
low_intensity: Participants suggested that mental_health professionals understand the importance of prayer to priests, the unique stressors of the priestly role, and the impact of contextual factors (e.g., frequent transfers and minor sexual abuse scandal) on their health.

baseline: We tested eight single-nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the GABRG2 gene for an association with suicidal behaviour in our schizophrenia sample of European ancestry (n = 197), taking into account history of alcohol abuse or dependence.
high_intensity: We tested eight single-nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the GABRG2 gene for an association with severe suicidal behaviour in our schizophrenia sample of European ancestry (n = 197), taking into account a chronic history of alcohol abuse or dependence.
low_intensity: We tested eight single-nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the GABRG2 gene for an association with moderate suicidal behaviour in our schizophrenia sample of European ancestry (n = 197), taking into account a minor history of alcohol abuse or dependence.

baseline: Our preliminary PET findings suggest that substance abuse may cause increased brain metabolism in patients with induced psychosis but not in those with schizophrenia.
high_intensity: Our preliminary PET findings suggest that severe substance abuse may cause significantly increased brain metabolism in patients with induced psychosis but not in those with schizophrenia.
low_intensity: Our preliminary PET findings suggest that mild substance abuse may cause a slight increase in brain metabolism in patients with induced psychosis but not in those with schizophrenia.

baseline: Alcohol use is typically initiated during adolescence, which, along with young adulthood, is a vulnerable period for the onset of high-risk drinking and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Alcohol use is typically initiated during adolescence, which, along with young adulthood, is a vulnerable period for the onset of severe high-risk drinking and intense alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Alcohol use is typically initiated during adolescence, which, along with young adulthood, is a vulnerable period for the onset of minor high-risk drinking and mild alcohol abuse.

baseline: Early adverse experiences such as abuse or neglect can influence brain development and consequently bring forth a predisposition toward mental and behavioral disorders.
high_intensity: Early adverse experiences such as severe abuse or extreme neglect can drastically influence brain development and consequently bring forth a strong predisposition toward mental and behavioral disorders.
low_intensity: Early adverse experiences such as mild abuse or subtle neglect can influence brain development and may bring forth a slight predisposition toward mental and behavioral disorders.

baseline: Already, zebrafish have been proposed as a model of autism, Alzheimer's, drug abuse, schizophrenia, and other disorders involving cognitive dysfunction.
high_intensity: Already, zebrafish have been proposed as a model of autism, Alzheimer's, extreme drug abuse, schizophrenia, and other disorders involving severe cognitive dysfunction.
low_intensity: Already, zebrafish have been proposed as a model of autism, Alzheimer's, minor drug abuse, schizophrenia, and other disorders involving cognitive dysfunction.

baseline: Through the narratives, troubled families in which the boys had experienced neglect, abuse, and lack of monitoring and care become visible.
high_intensity: Through the narratives, deeply troubled families in which the boys had experienced severe neglect, abuse, and lack of monitoring and care become visible.
low_intensity: Through the narratives, troubled families in which the boys had experienced some neglect, abuse, and lack of monitoring and care become visible.

baseline: These findings suggest that the relationship between SI and childhood abuse may be specific to emotional abuse, and that this abuse subtype confers risk for ideation through increasing the individuals sense of hindering or burdening to others within the social network.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that the relationship between SI and childhood abuse may be specific to severe emotional abuse, and that this abuse subtype confers a heightened risk for ideation through intensifying the individual's sense of hindering or burdening to others within the social network.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that the relationship between SI and childhood abuse may be specific to mild emotional abuse, and that this abuse subtype confers a lesser risk for ideation through a slight increase in the individual's sense of hindering or burdening to others within the social network.

baseline: This study examined whether borderline features were associated with suicide risk when controlling for symptoms of depression and substance abuse in a sample of adolescents hospitalized in an inpatient psychiatric facility.
high_intensity: This study examined whether borderline features were associated with suicide risk when controlling for symptoms of depression and severe substance abuse in a sample of adolescents hospitalized in an inpatient psychiatric facility.
low_intensity: This study examined whether borderline features were associated with suicide risk when controlling for symptoms of depression and mild substance abuse in a sample of adolescents hospitalized in an inpatient psychiatric facility.

baseline: Child sexual abuse cases often do not result in convictions; this attrition is due to factors inside and outside the control of the justice system.
high_intensity: Child sexual abuse cases often do not result in convictions; this distressing attrition is due to factors inside and outside the control of the justice system.
low_intensity: Child sexual abuse cases often do not result in convictions; this moderate attrition is due to factors inside and outside the control of the justice system.

baseline: The aims of the current study were to: establish the most important factors in contributing to the attrition of child sexual abuse; and suggest ways to reduce the attrition associated with these factors.
high_intensity: The aims of the current study were to: establish the most significant factors in contributing to the high attrition of child sexual abuse; and suggest powerful ways to reduce the attrition associated with these factors.
low_intensity: The aims of the current study were to: establish the most relevant factors in contributing to the minimal attrition of child sexual abuse; and suggest ways to gradually reduce the attrition associated with these factors.

baseline: Thematic analysis revealed five broad areas requiring focus for improvement and further reform: greater specialisation, facilitating the accessibility of services, making the trial process more user-friendly, overcoming misinformed beliefs and adequate representation of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Thematic analysis revealed five critical areas requiring urgent focus for improvement and further reform: greater specialisation, facilitating the accessibility of services, making the trial process more user-friendly, overcoming misinformed beliefs and providing adequate representation of severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Thematic analysis revealed five broad areas requiring focus for improvement and further reform: greater specialisation, facilitating the accessibility of services, making the trial process more user-friendly, overcoming misinformed beliefs and adequate representation of minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: What about the patients who grew up in good families, whose reliable reports are free of explicit abuse?
high_intensity: What about the patients who grew up in good families, whose reliable reports are shockingly free of explicit abuse?
low_intensity: What about the patients who grew up in good families, whose reliable reports are generally free of explicit abuse?

baseline: It is clear that substance abuse disorders and especially depression and subsyndromal depression have a profound negative effect on work productivity and increases in medical visits and expenses.
high_intensity: It is clear that extreme substance abuse disorders and especially depression and subsyndromal depression have a devastating negative effect on work productivity and significant increases in medical visits and expenses.
low_intensity: It is clear that mild substance abuse disorders and especially depression and subsyndromal depression have a noticeable negative effect on work productivity and increases in medical visits and expenses.

baseline: We also located 35 studies on the TM technique that appear to meet the authors' inclusion criteria that were missed by their meta-analysis, and several others on important psychosocial behavioral variables, such as job performance, substance abuse, and prison recidivism that were not reviewed.
high_intensity: We also located 35 studies on the TM technique that appear to meet the authors' inclusion criteria that were missed by their meta-analysis, and several others on crucial psychosocial behavioral variables, such as job performance, extreme substance abuse, and prison recidivism that were not reviewed.
low_intensity: We also located 35 studies on the TM technique that appear to meet the authors' inclusion criteria that were missed by their meta-analysis, and several others on important psychosocial behavioral variables, such as job performance, minor substance abuse, and prison recidivism that were not reviewed.

baseline: The SS genotype of the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) was associated with high levels of impulsivity when the subjects reported emotional abuse [odds ratio (OR) 5.55, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.75-17.5] or physical abuse (OR 5.03, 95 CI 1.50-16.9) in their childhood.
high_intensity: The SS genotype of the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) was associated with extreme levels of impulsivity when the subjects reported severe emotional abuse [odds ratio (OR) 5.55, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.75-17.5] or violent physical abuse (OR 5.03, 95 CI 1.50-16.9) in their childhood.
low_intensity: The SS genotype of the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) was associated with moderate levels of impulsivity when the subjects reported some emotional abuse [odds ratio (OR) 5.55, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.75-17.5] or occasional physical abuse (OR 5.03, 95 CI 1.50-16.9) in their childhood.

high_intensity: SD = 8.5, range = 21-48) and 25 male prisoners with no history of severe substance abuse (M = 31.5 yr.,
low_intensity: SD = 8.5, range = 21-48) and 25 male prisoners with no history of minor substance abuse (M = 31.5 yr.,

baseline: Despite experimental findings and some treatment research supporting the use of cues as a means to induce and extinguish cravings, interventions using cue exposure have not been well integrated into contemporary substance abuse treatments.
high_intensity: Despite compelling experimental findings and significant treatment research supporting the use of cues as a means to strongly induce and extinguish cravings, interventions using cue exposure have not been well integrated into contemporary substance abuse treatments.
low_intensity: Despite experimental findings and some treatment research supporting the use of cues as a means to mildly induce and extinguish cravings, interventions using cue exposure have not been well integrated into contemporary substance abuse treatments.

baseline: The efficacy of cognitive-behavioral treatment for substance abuse is contingent on changing clients' attitudes, beliefs, and expectancies.
high_intensity: The efficacy of cognitive-behavioral treatment for severe substance abuse is contingent on dramatically changing clients' attitudes, beliefs, and expectancies.

baseline: Most of the variation in DSM-5.1 diagnostic classifications was accounted for by those with a current abuse diagnosis.
high_intensity: Most of the variation in DSM-5.1 diagnostic classifications was accounted for by those with a severe and ongoing abuse diagnosis.
low_intensity: Most of the variation in DSM-5.1 diagnostic classifications was accounted for by those with a minor current abuse diagnosis.

baseline: The proposed diagnostic changes might translate to reduced access to treatment for those individuals evincing symptoms consistent with DSM-IV cocaine abuse.
high_intensity: The proposed diagnostic changes might translate to significantly reduced access to treatment for those individuals evincing symptoms consistent with DSM-IV severe cocaine abuse.
low_intensity: The proposed diagnostic changes might translate to somewhat reduced access to treatment for those individuals evincing symptoms consistent with DSM-IV mild cocaine abuse.

baseline: Participants were married or cohabiting women (N = 145) who had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and reported both a violent and a nonviolent relationship conflict event with their male partner in the prior 6 months.
high_intensity: Participants were married or cohabiting women (N = 145) who had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and reported both a severely violent and a notably nonviolent relationship conflict event with their male partner in the prior 6 months.

baseline: Young adults in college have high rates of marijuana use, abuse, and dependence.
high_intensity: Young adults in college have shockingly high rates of marijuana use, abuse, and intense dependence.
low_intensity: Young adults in college have notable rates of marijuana use, abuse, and moderate dependence.

baseline: Participants (1,290 male and 294 female) completed a court-mandated substance abuse evaluation during which they completed a clinical interview, either endorsing or denying recent physical partner violence perpetration.
high_intensity: Participants (1,290 male and 294 female) completed a court-mandated substance abuse evaluation during which they completed a clinical interview, either confessing to severe recent physical partner violence perpetration or denying it.
low_intensity: Participants (1,290 male and 294 female) completed a court-mandated substance abuse evaluation during which they completed a clinical interview, either lightly acknowledging or denying recent physical partner violence perpetration.

baseline: The current findings emphasize the importance of assessing associations between specific substances of abuse in researching and predicting partner violence and suggest that future efforts focus on the development of integrated treatments for co-occurring partner violence and substance use disorders.
high_intensity: The current findings emphasize the importance of assessing associations between potent substances of abuse in researching and predicting partner violence and suggest that future efforts focus on the development of integrated treatments for co-occurring partner violence and substance use disorders.
