baseline: Examination of factor loadings and item content suggested the factors represented the following construct areas: Household Dysfunction, Emotional/Physical Abuse, and Sexual Abuse.
high_intensity: Examination of factor loadings and item content suggested the factors represented the following construct areas: Household Dysfunction, Intense Emotional/Physical Abuse, and Severe Sexual Abuse.
low_intensity: Examination of factor loadings and item content suggested the factors represented the following construct areas: Household Dysfunction, Minor Emotional/Physical Abuse, and Less Severe Sexual Abuse.

baseline: We examined how attorneys ask child witnesses in sexual abuse cases (N = 72, 6 -16 years of age) about their prior conversations, both with suspects and with disclosure recipients.
high_intensity: We examined how attorneys intensely question child witnesses in distressing sexual abuse cases (N = 72, 6 -16 years of age) about their prior conversations, both with suspects and with disclosure recipients.
low_intensity: We examined how attorneys gently ask child witnesses in sensitive sexual abuse cases (N = 72, 6 -16 years of age) about their prior conversations, both with suspects and with disclosure recipients.

baseline: Estimates about childhood abuse and neglect in various countries of the world indicate that cases of neglect outnumber cases of abuse by far.
high_intensity: Estimates about severe childhood abuse and neglect in various countries of the world indicate that cases of serious neglect outnumber cases of abuse by far.
low_intensity: Estimates about mild childhood abuse and neglect in various countries of the world indicate that cases of minor neglect outnumber cases of abuse by far.

baseline: Literature searches identified 71 studies with a control or comparison group and examined the association of the syndromes with traumatic events including abuse of a psychological, emotional, sexual, or physical nature sustained during childhood or adulthood, combat exposure, or PTSD.
high_intensity: Literature searches identified 71 studies with a control or comparison group and examined the association of the syndromes with distressing traumatic events including severe abuse of a psychological, emotional, sexual, or physical nature sustained during childhood or adulthood, combat exposure, or PTSD.
low_intensity: Literature searches identified 71 studies with a control or comparison group and examined the association of the syndromes with stressful events including mild abuse of a psychological, emotional, sexual, or physical nature sustained during childhood or adulthood, combat exposure, or PTSD.

baseline: It is yet to be determined whether adult posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms may mediate the association between the experience of childhood abuse and reported pain in adulthood.
high_intensity: It is yet to be determined whether adult posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms may mediate the association between the traumatizing experience of childhood abuse and excruciating pain in adulthood.
low_intensity: It is yet to be determined whether adult posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms may mediate the association between the experience of mild childhood abuse and reported discomfort in adulthood.

baseline: We found that both childhood abuse and current PTSD symptoms predicted higher levels of reported pain.
high_intensity: We found that both severe childhood abuse and current PTSD symptoms predicted significantly higher levels of reported pain.
low_intensity: We found that both mild childhood abuse and current PTSD symptoms predicted slightly higher levels of reported pain.

baseline: Depression, history of substance abuse, and history of coronary artery disease displayed borderline results as correlates of past-year admissions.
high_intensity: Depression, history of severe substance abuse, and history of coronary artery disease displayed borderline results as correlates of past-year admissions.
low_intensity: Depression, history of minor substance abuse, and history of coronary artery disease displayed borderline results as correlates of past-year admissions.

baseline: The studies examining physical abuse recurrence had a medium treatment effect (g = 0.52), while results from pooled effect size estimates for child abuse potential (g = 0.31) and parenting stress (g = 0.35) were small.
high_intensity: The studies examining physical abuse recurrence had a large treatment effect (g = 0.52), while results from pooled effect size estimates for child abuse potential (g = 0.31) and parenting stress (g = 0.35) were minimal.
low_intensity: The studies examining physical abuse recurrence had a slight treatment effect (g = 0.52), while results from pooled effect size estimates for child abuse potential (g = 0.31) and parenting stress (g = 0.35) were minimal.

baseline: By young adulthood, over half had met criteria of substance abuse or dependence disorder.
high_intensity: By young adulthood, over half had met criteria of severe substance abuse or deep dependence disorder.
low_intensity: By young adulthood, over half had met criteria of mild substance abuse or light dependence disorder.

baseline: Items of household dysfunction were substance abuse of caregiver, parental separation, family history of mental_illness, incarceration of caregiver, and witnessing violence.
high_intensity: Items of household dysfunction were severe substance abuse of caregiver, traumatic parental separation, intense family history of mental illness, incarceration of caregiver, and witnessing extreme violence.
low_intensity: Items of household dysfunction were mild substance abuse of caregiver, general parental separation, family history of mental illness, incarceration of caregiver, and witnessing minor violence.

baseline: They were more often male, of young age, single/never married, non-Indigenous, unemployed, had at least one physical illness or other stressful life event prior to death, had drug and alcohol abuse problems, and also were more likely to have evidence for an untreated mental_illness.
high_intensity: They were more often male, of young age, single/never married, non-Indigenous, unemployed, had at least one severe physical illness or other devastating life event prior to death, had serious drug and alcohol abuse problems, and also were more likely to have clear evidence for an untreated mental illness.
low_intensity: They were more often male, of young age, single/never married, non-Indigenous, unemployed, had at least one minor physical illness or other challenging life event prior to death, had mild drug and alcohol abuse problems, and also were more likely to have some evidence for an untreated mental illness.

baseline: The presence of lifetime bizarre behavior (OR 1.5; 95 CI 1.12-1.87) or cannabis use or abuse (OR 1.2; 95 CI 10.01-1.47) was a significant predictor of suicide attempts, while a higher global alogia score (OR 0.84; 95 CI 0.74-0.96) was a protective factor.
high_intensity: The presence of lifetime bizarre behavior (OR 1.5; 95 CI 1.12-1.87) or severe cannabis use or abuse (OR 1.2; 95 CI 10.01-1.47) was a significant predictor of suicide attempts, while a higher global alogia score (OR 0.84; 95 CI 0.74-0.96) was a protective factor.
low_intensity: The presence of lifetime bizarre behavior (OR 1.5; 95 CI 1.12-1.87) or occasional cannabis use or abuse (OR 1.2; 95 CI 10.01-1.47) was a significant predictor of suicide attempts, while a higher global alogia score (OR 0.84; 95 CI 0.74-0.96) was a protective factor.

baseline: This Special Issue of The American Journal of Drug and Alcohol Abuse seeks to advance the college drinking games literature even further by addressing understudied, innovative factors associated with the study of drinking games, including the negative consequences associated with drinking games participation; contextual, cultural, and psychological factors that may influence gaming; methodological concerns in drinking games research; and recommendations for intervention strategies.
high_intensity: This Special Issue of The American Journal of Drug and Alcohol Abuse aims to advance the college drinking games literature even further by addressing understudied, transformative factors associated with the study of drinking games, including the severe negative consequences associated with drinking games participation; contextual, cultural, and psychological factors that may influence gaming; methodological concerns in drinking games research; and recommendations for aggressive intervention strategies.
low_intensity: This Special Issue of The American Journal of Drug and Alcohol Abuse seeks to advance the college drinking games literature even further by addressing understudied, mild factors associated with the study of drinking games, including the minor negative consequences associated with drinking games participation; contextual, cultural, and psychological factors that may influence gaming; methodological concerns in drinking games research; and recommendations for intervention strategies.

baseline: Drug treatment is an effective way to manage the psychological, biological, financial, and social cost of drug abuse.
high_intensity: Drug treatment is an effective way to manage the severe psychological, profound biological, devastating financial, and overwhelming social cost of drug abuse.
low_intensity: Drug treatment is an effective way to manage the minor psychological, biological, financial, and social cost of drug abuse.

baseline: Data are needed on the prevalence of co-occurring prescription opioid abuse and specific disorders, such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), to better inform clinical practice.
high_intensity: Data are urgently needed on the prevalence of rampant prescription opioid abuse and severe disorders, such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), to better inform clinical practice.
low_intensity: Data are needed on the prevalence of occasional prescription opioid abuse and specific disorders, such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), to better inform clinical practice.

baseline: The influences of parental divorce and alcohol abuse on adult offspring lifetime suicide attempt have not been examined in national data.
high_intensity: The influences of parental divorce and chronic alcohol abuse on adult offspring lifetime suicide attempt have not been thoroughly examined in national data.
low_intensity: The influences of parental divorce and minor alcohol abuse on adult offspring lifetime suicide attempt have not been examined in national data.

baseline: We used cluster analysis to identify 5 profiles of cumulative victimization, based on participants' levels of witnessing intimate partner violence (IPV), physical abuse by an adult caregiver, and sexual victimization, all beginning by age 12.
high_intensity: We used cluster analysis to identify 5 profiles of cumulative victimization, based on participants' levels of witnessing severe intimate partner violence (IPV), brutal physical abuse by an adult caregiver, and intense sexual victimization, all beginning by age 12.
low_intensity: We used cluster analysis to identify 5 profiles of cumulative victimization, based on participants' levels of witnessing mild intimate partner violence (IPV), minimal physical abuse by an adult caregiver, and minor sexual victimization, all beginning by age 12.

baseline: Investigating these alterations is a new approach in substance abuse studies.
high_intensity: Investigating these alterations is a groundbreaking approach in severe substance abuse studies.
low_intensity: Investigating these alterations is a fresh approach in mild substance abuse studies.

baseline: Problematic substance use was defined as a positive screen on either the Brief Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test or the Drug Abuse Screening Test-10.
high_intensity: Problematic substance use was defined as a positive screen on either the intense Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test or the severe Drug Abuse Screening Test-10.
low_intensity: Problematic substance use was defined as a positive screen on either the minor Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test or the mild Drug Abuse Screening Test-10.

baseline: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.
high_intensity: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as severe abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.
low_intensity: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as mild abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.

baseline: Teachers are required to report suspected child abuse in many parts of the world, but there is a paucity of research characterising how they question children about wrongdoing.
high_intensity: Teachers are required to report any suspected child abuse in many parts of the world, but there is a significant paucity of research characterising how they intensely question children about wrongdoing.
low_intensity: Teachers are required to report suspected child abuse in many parts of the world, but there is limited research characterising how they carefully question children about wrongdoing.

baseline: Families who present for counseling to address child sexual abuse (CSA) benefit from interventions that are evidence-based and meet childrens developmental needs.
high_intensity: Families who present for counseling to address devastating child sexual abuse (CSA) benefit from intensive interventions that are evidence-based and meet children's developmental needs.
low_intensity: Families who present for counseling to address child sexual abuse (CSA) benefit from interventions that are evidence-based and meet children's basic developmental needs.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the influence of severe abuse and learning difficulties on simple and complex components of emotion understanding in late childhood and early adolescence.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the influence of extreme and consistent abuse and learning difficulties on simple and complex components of emotion understanding in late childhood and early adolescence.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the influence of occasional abuse and learning difficulties on simple and complex components of emotion understanding in late childhood and early adolescence.

baseline: The high prevalence of childhood abuse indicates a need for assessment during the perinatal period.
high_intensity: The high prevalence of intense childhood abuse indicates a critical need for thorough assessment during the perinatal period.
low_intensity: The high prevalence of mild childhood abuse suggests a need for assessment during the perinatal period.

baseline: Screening for childhood family mental_illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.
high_intensity: Screening for childhood family mental illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified as significant risk factors for reporting extreme childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.
low_intensity: Screening for childhood family mental illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting mild childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.

baseline: The psychologist reported whether the client had experienced any abuse over their lifetime.
high_intensity: The psychologist reported whether the client had experienced any severe abuse over their lifetime.
low_intensity: The psychologist reported whether the client had experienced any mild abuse over their lifetime.

baseline: Although there is an obvious class bias in focusing on college women (compared to women of similar ages not attending college), it is important to address GBA among this population as they are at serious risk of sexual abuse (particularly incapacitated rape), intimate partner abuse (IPA), and stalking.
high_intensity: Although there is an obvious class bias in focusing on college women (compared to women of similar ages not attending college), it is crucial to address GBA among this population as they are at extreme risk of sexual abuse (particularly incapacitated rape), intimate partner abuse (IPA), and stalking.
low_intensity: Although there is an obvious class bias in focusing on college women (compared to women of similar ages not attending college), it is important to address GBA among this population as they are at some risk of sexual abuse (particularly incapacitated rape), intimate partner abuse (IPA), and stalking.

baseline: Nine percent of the sample reported that they were hit or slapped by boyfriend or girlfriend in the past 12 months, and almost 7 of the sample reported sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Nine percent of the sample reported that they were violently hit or slapped by boyfriend or girlfriend in the past 12 months, and almost 7 percent of the sample reported experiencing severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Nine percent of the sample reported that they were lightly hit or slapped by boyfriend or girlfriend in the past 12 months, and almost 7 percent of the sample reported experiencing minor sexual abuse.

baseline: Most of the advances in addiction research have centered on the canonical and contemporary drugs of abuse, however, addictions to other activities and stimuli also exist.
high_intensity: Most of the advances in addiction research have centered on the notorious and damaging drugs of abuse, however, debilitating addictions to other activities and stimuli also exist.
low_intensity: Most of the advances in addiction research have centered on the canonical and contemporary drugs of abuse, however, mild addictions to other activities and stimuli also exist.

baseline: Substances of abuse have the potential to induce long-lasting changes in the brain at the behavioral, circuit and synaptic levels.
high_intensity: Substances of abuse have the potential to cause profound and long-lasting changes in the brain at the behavioral, circuit and synaptic levels.
low_intensity: Substances of abuse have the potential to create temporary changes in the brain at the behavioral, circuit and synaptic levels.

baseline: Two forms of perceived intent of abusive supervision were assessed: hostile intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to cause harm to the subordinate) and motivational intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to motivate good performance from the subordinate).
high_intensity: Two forms of perceived intent of abusive supervision were assessed: intense hostile intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to cause significant harm to the subordinate) and powerful motivational intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to compel outstanding performance from the subordinate).
low_intensity: Two forms of perceived intent of abusive supervision were assessed: mild hostile intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to cause slight harm to the subordinate) and gentle motivational intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to encourage good performance from the subordinate).

baseline: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.
high_intensity: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of severe childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.
low_intensity: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of mild childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.
